0.title: Pic showing job aspirants studying for exams at Bihar ghat goes viral
0.article_body: A photo featuring hundreds of students sitting at a ghat near Patna University in Bihar is being widely shared on social media. The students studying at the ghat are said to be preparing for various exams like SSC, UPSC and JEE, among others. A user commented, "This is how a Bihari prepare for government jobs. Respect the dedication."

1.title: Chelsea need to rely on Liverpool, Man City having a 'meltdown': Cech
1.article_body: Ex-Chelsea footballer Petr Cech said Chelsea will need to rely on Liverpool and Manchester City having a "meltdown" to win the Premier League. "It is...out of our hands," added Cech. City are currently at the top of the points table, with Liverpool and Chelsea on the second and third position. City and Chelsea have 74 and 62 points, respectively.

2.title: Scientists discover cluster of cells in brainstem to treat blood loss
2.article_body: Scientists have discovered a cluster of cells in the brainstem that may help in controlling the body's response to blood loss that results in cardiovascular collapse. Known as adrenergic C1 neurons, these cells monitor blood pressure during blood loss. When they detect blood loss, their nerve activity increases constricting the blood vessels to maintain proper blood pressure.

3.title: Some plants left with only 1.5 days of coal: Maha Energy Minister
3.article_body: Maharashtra is grappling with an acute power crisis due to coal shortage, state Energy Minister Nitin Raut said. "While some plants are left with only 1.5 days of coal, some have coal that would suffice for three days," he added. "Koyna Dam is left with 17 TMCs of water; one TMC is needed every day to generate electricity," Raut stated.

4.title: TMC's Babul Supriyo wins Ballygunge Assembly by-polls
4.article_body: Former Union Minister and TMC leader Babul Supriyo won the Ballygunge by-polls on Saturday by defeating BJP's Keya Ghosh. As trends suggested his win, Supriyo appreciated West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee by saying, "Didi guided us for working on ground." Meanwhile, BJP's Agnimitra Paul, who lost the Asansol Lok Sabha seat to TMC's Shatrughan Sinha, said, "Babul Supriyo's victory...was predictable."

5.title: Umran is unique, but he concedes fours on many occasions: Williamson
5.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said pacer Umran Malik is "unique" considering his ability to bowl at a speed of 150 kmph, but added that he concedes fours on many occasions which is not "ideal". Malik took two wickets while conceding 27 runs in SRH's win against KKR by seven wickets. He has picked five wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

6.title: 38-year-old Noida man drowns in Yamuna river while taking a dip
6.article_body: A 38-year-old man from Noida drowned in the Yamuna river while taking a dip, police officials said. According to the officials, the man had gone with his family to pray at a temple on the river bank when the incident occurred. He was pulled out from the river and rushed to a hospital but he didn't survive, an official said.

7.title: Pak National Assembly Deputy Speaker resigns before no-trust motion
7.article_body: Qasim Khan Suri resigned as Deputy Speaker of Pakistan's National Assembly, less than an hour before voting on a no-trust motion against him was to take place for favouring the Imran Khan-led government. Sharing a copy of his resignation on Twitter, Suri said his move signified his association with the vision of his party, the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), and democracy.

8.title: 183 dead dogs, lizards, birds found in US man's freezer; some were stuffed alive
8.article_body: A man in US' Arizona is facing animal cruelty charges after 183 dead dogs, lizards, rabbits, birds and other animals were found in a "large-sized chest freezer". "Several of the animals appeared to have been frozen alive due to their body positioning," police said. He was caught after a woman complained he hadn't returned snakes she'd lent him for breeding.

9.title: The younger and elder called Hema 'ji', she commanded that respect: Ranjeet
9.article_body: Actor Ranjeet took to Instagram to share a throwback picture of him with actress Hema Malini and said that everyone used to address her as 'ji'. "She always commanded that respect on sets. Chahe koi chota ho ya bada [No matter the person was younger or elder]," he wrote. Several users took to comments section to appreciate the picture.

10.title: 4 policemen booked for abetting suicide of school teacher in UP
10.article_body: Four policemen were booked for abetting a government primary school teacher's suicide in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj in March 2020. The victim was found hanging in a washroom of the Tirwa Police Station after he was brought for allegedly creating nuisance at his in-laws' house. The victim's family had alleged that death occurred due to severe beating by the policemen.

11.title: Harbhajan to donate Rajya Sabha salary for education of farmers' daughters
11.article_body: Cricketer-turned-politician Harbhajan Singh on Saturday pledged to donate his salary as a Rajya Sabha member toward the education and welfare of farmers' daughters. "I've joined to contribute to the betterment of our nation and will do everything I can," said Singh while announcing the decision on Twitter. Singh was nominated as Rajya Sabha member by the AAP government in Punjab.

12.title: Ranbir thinks there should be mystery around an actor: Neetu on wedding secrecy
12.article_body: Talking about keeping Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding a secret, actress Neetu Kapoor said that actor Ranbir Kapoor believes that there should be a mystery around an actor. "He likes certain things to be private and one of them is his personal life and we all should respect it," she added.

13.title: Chinese astronauts land after China's longest crewed space mission
13.article_body: Three Chinese astronauts returned to earth on Saturday after 183 days in space, completing China's longest crewed space mission to date. Zhai Zhigang, Ye Guangfu and Wang Yaping spent six months aboard the Tianhe core module of China's Tiangong space station. The crew was the second of four crewed missions to be launched during 2021-2022 to assemble space station.

14.title: Nagaland govt refuses to grant 'casual leave' to protesting doctors
14.article_body: The Nagaland government has refused to grant "casual leave" to doctors protesting for increasing the retirement age from 60 to 62. The decision was taken following reports of the Nagaland In-Service Doctors Association asking its members to take "mass casual leave" from April 18 to 20 in protest, the state's Chief Secretary J Alam said in a statement.

15.title: TMC's Shatrughan wins Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls by over 3 lakh votes
15.article_body: Trinamool Congress' Shatrughan Prasad Sinha on Saturday won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls by over three lakh votes, helping his party win the constituency for the first time. Sinha defeated BJP's Agnimitra Paul. The seat had fallen vacant after singer-politician Babul Supriyo left BJP and joined TMC. "I was confident poetic justice will prevail," Supriyo said about Sinha's win.

16.title: UK PM Johnson banned from entering Russia after visit to Ukraine
16.article_body: Russia has barred entry to UK PM Boris Johnson, Foreign Secretary Liz Truss, Defence Secretary Ben Wallace, and 10 other British government politicians and members. The move was taken "in view of the unprecedented hostile action by the British Government, in particular the imposition of sanctions against senior Russian officials", Russia said. Earlier, Johnson visited Ukraine amid the war.

17.title: Duo pose as astrologers, cheat businessman of ₹46 lakh near B'luru
17.article_body: A 45-year-old businessman was allegedly cheated ₹46 lakh by two men who posed as astrologers near Bengaluru. The accused reportedly promised to solve the businessman's personal problems and demanded money from him on the pretext of various pujas and ceremonies. However, the duo went incommunicado after receiving the money, following which the victim approached the police and lodged a complaint.

18.title: Their unit in Himachal Pradesh is finished: Anurag Thakur to AAP
18.article_body: Reacting to AAP leaders' visits to Himachal Pradesh ahead of the state Assembly polls, BJP leader Anurag Thakur said, "They have no ground here, their unit is finished." Thakur's statement comes after AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari along with general secretary organisation Satish Thakur and Una chief Iqbal Singh joined BJP on April 9.

19.title: 63-yr-old cheated of ₹5.9 lakh on pretext of updating KYC in Pune
19.article_body: A senior citizen in Pune was cheated of ₹5.9 lakh after being asked to update the KYC information linked to his phone number by a fraudster. The 63-year-old claimed that he was told to download an application on the phone for the update. The fraudster withdrew ₹90,000 from the victim's account and also took out a loan of ₹5 lakh.

20.title: Security forces foil terror plot in J&K, recover & destroy IED: Police
20.article_body: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri found a suspicious object lying alongside a road, which was identified as an Improvised Explosive Device (IED). They took the recovered IED to a safer location and destroyed it, thereby foiling a terror plot, police said. They had received inputs about suspicious movements in the area following which they launched a search operation.

21.title: 'Lotas' thrown at Deputy Speaker in Pak's Punjab Assembly; security tries to catch them
21.article_body: Members of of Pakistan's Punjab Assembly threw 'lotas' (water pot) at Deputy Speaker Dost Muhammad Mazari, a video of which is being widely circulated online. Mazari's security personnel could be seen trying to catch the pots that were being flung at him. Mazari was also reportedly slapped by Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party members.

22.title: Missing child found with 14-yr-old girl in UP, reward announced for her
22.article_body: A special reward has been announced for a 14-year-old girl after a missing two-and-a-half-year-old child was found in her care in Uttar Pradesh. Police inspected CCTV footage where she could be seen enquiring about child's guardian. Police then reached her house and found missing child. Reports said the girl found child near her house around midnight.

23.title: It's natural that there'll be decline: Akhtar on Pollard's form in IPL
23.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said since MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard has won so many matches for his side in IPL before, it's natural that there'll be a decline in his performance at some point. "I hope he finds his form...plays for one-two more years for Mumbai," he added. The 34-year-old has scored 57 runs from five matches in ongoing IPL.

24.title: Complaint against Punjab CM for allegedly visiting gurudwara after getting drunk
24.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party's Tajinder Bagga has filed a police complaint against Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann for allegedly entering gurudwara Damdama Sahib while being drunk. "Filed police complaint against Punjab CM @BhagwantMann for entering gurudwara Damdama Sahib in drunk condition. I request @DGPPunjabPolice @PunjabPoliceInd to take action on my complaint," Bagga wrote on Twitter.

25.title: 19-yr-old kills 25-yr-old man over past disputes in Gujarat, arrested
25.article_body: A 19-year-old allegedly killed a 25-year-old man in Gujarat's Rakhial over past disputes on Thursday. Identified as Tabrej Pathan, the accused was arrested while he was trying to flee on an interstate bus after committing the crime. He has been charged under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

26.title: Parts of B'luru to face power cuts tomorrow; list of areas released
26.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited has said that several areas in the city will be facing power interruptions tomorrow, i.e. on Sunday, due to maintenance works. All zones of the city will face power cuts from around 10 am to 5.30 pm. The affected areas include Gottigere, Shantiniketan Layout, Umar Nagar, Narayanapura, Uttarahalli, Chikka Adugodi and RT Nagar, among others.

27.title: Winless MI to bowl first against LSG, both teams make one change each
27.article_body: MI have won the toss and elected to bowl first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash. Both the teams have made one change each to their playing XIs. Fabian Allen has replaced Basil Thampi in MI's playing XI, while Manish Pandey has replaced Krishnappa Gowtham for LSG. Notably, MI are on a five-match losing streak.

28.title: R Madhavan's son wins silver medal at Danish Open Swimming meet
28.article_body: Actor R Madhavan on Saturday took to social media to announce that his son Vedaant won the silver medal in the men's 1500m freestyle event at the Danish Open swimming meet in Copenhagen, Denmark. Sharing pictures Madhavan wrote, "Thank you sooo much Coach Pradeep sir, SFI and ANSA. We are so Proud." Vedaant clocked 15.57.86 in the 10-swimmer final.

29.title: Movies were always on the agenda: KGF actress Srinidhi Shetty
29.article_body: KGF actress Srinidhi Shetty said she always wanted to act in movies but didn't expect it to be this soon. Srinidhi, who was crowned Miss Diva Supranational in 2016, said, "It's all like a dream...I thought...I would...give auditions but things happened quickly." While talking about KGF, Srinidhi said she couldn't believe that she landed a role in the movie.

30.title: Lalu Yadav's RJD wins Bochahan Assembly seat in Bihar by-polls
30.article_body: Lalu Prasad Yadav's RJD on Saturday won Bochahan Assembly seat in Bihar by-polls by over 36,000 votes, data released by Election Commission on Saturday shows. RJD's Amar Kumar Paswan got 82,562 votes while his nearest rival, BJP's Baby Kumari got 45,909 votes. Geeta Kumari from Vikassheel Insaan Party got the third-highest votes while Congress candidate Tarun Chaudhary got 1,336 votes.

31.title: Rescued mare, stallion named after Alia-Ranbir as wedding gift; Pooja Bhatt shares pic
31.article_body: Actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor, who got married on Thursday, have been commended by animal welfare NGO Animal Rahat for not using a horse for the 'baraat' ceremony. The NGO has named a rescued mare and stallion pair after the couple. Alia's half-sister Pooja Bhatt shared a picture of the horses on Instagram writing, "This is absolutely amazing!"

32.title: Making efforts to fill vacancies, improve judicial infra: CJI NV Ramana
32.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana on Friday said he is making efforts in filling up vacancies and improving the infrastructure of judiciary soon after taking over as CJI. "Access to justice is possible only when we provide sufficient number of courts...[and] infrastructure," he said. Ramana also assured he's doing his utmost to solve the security issues of judges.

33.title: Woman being kidnapped by ex-boyfriend uses viral hand signal in US; saved
33.article_body: A woman who was allegedly being kidnapped by her ex-boyfriend in US' Tennessee was rescued by police after she used a viral one-handed signal to show someone silently that you're in danger. The woman had shown the sign to a cashier at a gas station, following which the cashier informed the police. The police arrested the accused after tasing him.

34.title: Jackky Bhagnani launches devotional channel 'Jjust Pooja'
34.article_body: Actor-producer Jackky Bhagnani has launched a devotional channel, 'Jjust Pooja', under his music label 'Jjust Music'. The first track under the label will be Hanuman Chalisa, composed by Ved Sharma and sung by Ankit Tiwari. Jackky said, "We've taken...name of Jjust Pooja from my mother's name, Pooja. It's a special feeling for me, as I present...special ode to her with...channel."

35.title: Angry over excess salt in khichdi, man strangles wife to death in Maharashtra
35.article_body: A 46-year-old man allegedly strangled his wife to death in a fit of rage after the khichdi made by her for breakfast had excess salt, police said on Saturday. The incident took place in Maharashtra's Thane on Friday and the man was arrested. In another incident, a woman was allegedly shot dead in Thane for not serving tea with breakfast.

36.title: 18-yr-old kidnapped, killed over love affair in Pune; 9 minors booked
36.article_body: Police have arrested a 23-year-old man and booked nine minors involved in the murder of an 18-year-old boy following a previous dispute over a love affair in the Pune district. According to police, the teenager was kidnapped on Tuesday and was later stoned to death by the accused. The deceased has been identified as Krushna Relekar, who stayed in Moshi.

37.title: Restaurant owner in Turkey tries to launch a kebab into space, shares video
37.article_body: A kebab shop owner in Turkey attempted to launch a pipe kebab into space through a helium balloon. A box was specially designed to hold the dish, fitted with a camera and a tracking device. Performed on the 61st anniversary of the first human spaceflight, the kebab managed to reach a height of 38 km before the balloon exploded.

38.title: Root has done for England what Kohli did for India: Lalchand Rajput
38.article_body: Reacting to Joe Root stepping down as England's Test captain, ex-Team India manager Lalchand Rajput said Root has been a role model for many years as a captain. "Root has done for England what Virat Kohli did for India," added Rajput. "Root came to India and [would]...score a hundred on the turning pitches," stated Rajput.

39.title: India can't afford to remain stagnant at this juncture: PM Modi
39.article_body: India cannot afford to remain stagnant at this juncture and it has to become self-reliant, PM Narendra Modi said. "I would request the saints of the country to teach people to buy local products only...we should only use things made by our people," he added. PM was speaking after virtually unveiling a 108-foot-tall statue of Lord Hanuman in Gujarat's Morbi.

40.title: Musk uses inverted smile emoji on his 2017 tweet about Twitter price
40.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reacted to his own tweet from 2017, in which he had asked about how much it would cost to buy Twitter, with an inverted smile emoji. "I love Twitter. How much is it?" Musk had written in the tweet. Earlier this week, Musk made a $43 billion bid to buy Twitter.

41.title: Male nurse, 4 others held in ex-Army man's murder case in B'luru
41.article_body: A male nurse and four others have been arrested for the murder of an ex-Army man in Bengaluru in a bid to steal valuables, police said on Saturday. The nurse had been taking care of the deceased's mother, who'd passed away a few months ago. The accused also sprinkled chilli powder on the body to trick sniffer dogs, police added.

42.title: Delhi govt to provide precautionary COVID-19 vaccine doses for free soon
42.article_body: The Delhi government said on Friday that precautionary doses of coronavirus vaccines will soon be provided free of cost to people at its hospitals. It said those who have taken both doses will get the precautionary dose of the same vaccine. These doses were made available for all aged above 18 years at private vaccination centres from April 10.

43.title: Up to 3,000 Ukrainian troops killed since Russia invaded: Zelenskyy
43.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that up to 3,000 Ukrainian troops have been killed since Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered the invasion of Ukraine. He added there are about 10,000 Ukrainian troops who've been injured and that it's "hard to say how many will survive". Zelenskyy also said that 19,000 to 20,000 Russian soldiers have been killed in the war.

44.title: Age-shaming has always been a problem: Shruti Haasan
44.article_body: Shruti Haasan, while citing the example of Hollywood, said age-shaming has always been a problem. "It's a human thing to age and...a common thing to talk about," she added. Shruti said she considers women like Meryl Streep, Madonna and Jennifer Lopez as her heroes, adding, age doesn't exist for her. "I think it shouldn't exist in anyone's universe," she said.

45.title: Student bodies may be anti-establishment, but must not divide society: RSS
45.article_body: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale said that student organisations are supposed to be anti-establishment, but they should not raise voices of division and speak about the country's culture with disgust. He further said that ABVP workers had sacrificed their lives to "stop those in universities who want to bring revolution through the barrel of the gun".

46.title: Mumbai woman sexually harassed by cyber-fraudsters, extorted ₹4.5 lakh
46.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was sexually harassed by cyber-fraudsters in a loan scam cyber-fraud case in Mumbai. Almost ₹4.5 lakh was allegedly extorted from the complainant in the name of a loan that she never took, police said. According to the FIR registered at the Charkop police station, the complainant's mobile number was circulated by the accused on social media sites.

47.title: Attempt for communal rift, you'll see Owaisi enter: Patil on loudspeaker row
47.article_body: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil said that MNS chief Raj Thackeray's loudspeaker remark is a "deliberate attempt to create communal tension" in Maharashtra. "In coming days you'll see entry of Owaisi in picture after Raj Thackeray. It's an attempt to start communal rift & untoward incidents in the state," Patil added. Thackeray had earlier demanded removal of loudspeakers in mosques.

48.title: 2 killed, 1 hurt as auto overturns on old Pune-Mumbai Expressway
48.article_body: Two persons were killed and one person was injured after an auto-rickshaw overturned in Khandala ghat on the old Pune-Mumbai Expressway on Friday. According to the police, the incident took place at around 4 am when the three men were going towards Khopoli in the auto-rickshaw. The injured man has been admitted to a hospital for further treatment.

49.title: Mumbai Police uses Bollywood movie titles to promote road safety
49.article_body: Mumbai Police shared a few posts on Instagram using the titles of Bollywood movies to talk about road safety measures. "I won't drive Mere Dad Ki Maruti without a license," one of their posts read. "I won't overspeed because I know Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara," read another. Mumbai Police often posts creative messages preaching traffic rules.

50.title: China's military threat will only increase support for us: Taiwan
50.article_body: Taiwan has said that China's military threats against the island will only increase support for it from the US and other democracies. The comments come after China conducted drills around Taiwan on Friday as US lawmakers visited Taipei. Taiwan's Foreign Ministry said China's reaction to the visit was "recalcitrant and ridiculous". China claims democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory.

51.title: 5 of family, including 3 children, found murdered in UP's Prayagraj
51.article_body: Five members of a family, including three children, were found murdered at their home in Khagalpur village in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, police said on Saturday. The incident took place under the Nawabganj Police Station area on Friday night, police added. "Under the rule of BJP government 2.0, UP has drowned in crime," Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav tweeted.

52.title: Brazilian Prez criticises WhatsApp for not launching 'Communities'
52.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has criticised WhatsApp for reportedly deciding not to launch its new 'Communities' feature in Brazil until this year's presidential election is over. "What WhatsApp is doing all over the world is no problem, but making an exception in Brazil is unacceptable," he said. 'Communities' will help users bring separate groups together.

53.title: MP hospital sees 54 dog bite cases in 2 days, 4 suffer serious injuries
53.article_body: Several dog bite cases have allegedly been reported in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha. Dr Sameer Kirar from the district hospital said that the hospital saw 30 cases on April 14 and 24 cases on April 15. "We administered them injections," he added. The doctor also said that four patients have received serious bite injuries.

54.title: PVR Chairman Ajay Bijli forms a band in his 50s, releases 1st music video
54.article_body: PVR Chairman Ajay Bijli has launched a music video with his band Random Order. He dedicated the song, 'Don't let the sun go down on me', originally sung by Elton John, to the medical community for their service during the COVID-19 pandemic. "The idea was to tell a story," said Bijli, who launched the band in his 50s.

55.title: Squid Game actor Lee Jung-jae's directorial debut to premiere at Cannes
55.article_body: 'Squid Game' actor Lee Jung-jae's directorial debut titled 'Hunt' will have its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival this year. According to Variety, the film will be shown next month in the festival's Midnight Screening section. Lee also stars in the Korean-language spy thriller movie alongside veteran actor Jung Woo-Sung. Cannes Film Festival will be held from May 17-28.

56.title: Man cheated of ₹26 lakh by person posing as his brother in Pune
56.article_body: A case was filed at Pune's Sahakar Nagar police station by a 68-year-old man who was allegedly cheated of ₹26 lakh by a person posing as his brother. The police said that the accused used the brother's picture as WhatsApp profile picture. The accused had sent a fake screenshot claiming that he'd transferred ₹26 lakh to the complainant, police added.

57.title: Pic of Umran Malik's field for Shreyas Iyer goes viral, fans react
57.article_body: A picture of SRH pacer Umran Malik's field for Shreyas Iyer in KKR's 10th over has gone viral. All fielders outside the 30-yard circle were behind square. Umran clean bowled Iyer with a yorker on the last ball. "Man made him think he will bowl short and ditched with a yorker," a fan tweeted. "This is proper humiliation," wrote another.

58.title: Happy about South films being remade in B'wood: Thadam actor Arun Vijay
58.article_body: Arun Vijay, who predominantly works in the Tamil film industry, spoke about the Hindi remakes of South films and said, "I'm happy about South films being remade in Bollywood. We're taking cinema to...next level." Arun's 2019 film 'Thadam' is being remade in Hindi with actor Aditya Roy Kapur. "As...Tamil section of...industry, I'd love our films to go pan-India," he added.

59.title: Bhopal Police on high alert, to monitor Hanuman Jayanti processions with drones
59.article_body: The Bhopal Police will monitor the Hanuman Jayanti processions using video cameras and drones, Bhopal Police Commissioner Makrand Deuskar said. "Apart from this, a police force will also be deployed in plain-clothes to keep a watch on miscreants," he added. On Ram Navami, stone-pelting incident was reported in Madhya Pradesh in which several people, including a police inspector, were injured.

60.title: Be prepared for Russia using nuclear weapons: Ukraine President to the world
60.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has warned "all of the countries of the world" need to be ready for Russian President Vladimir Putin using nuclear weapons. "For Russia the life of the people is nothing. We should...not be afraid but be ready," he said. Earlier, US' CIA warned Putin could deploy tactical or low-yield nuclear weapons in Ukraine.

61.title: Malaika shares selfie on Instagram after car accident, says she's 'healing'
61.article_body: Malaika Arora took to her Instagram Stories on Friday to share a picture of herself. The actress, who met with an accident on the Mumbai-Pune highway earlier this month, shared the picture with a sticker that read, "Healing." She was taken to Apollo Hospital in Navi Mumbai for treatment after receiving some minor injuries in the accident.

62.title: 3 men burnt alive as car rams into truck in Haryana's Panipat
62.article_body: At least three people were burnt alive after a CNG-powered car they were travelling in rammed into a truck near Istana village on Panipat-Rohtak highway in Haryana, police said. The deceased were private lab technicians and were going shopping for a 'jagran', police added. Officials doused the fire but the three occupants of the car had already died by then.

63.title: Police bust cricket betting racket in Hyderabad, seize ₹2.80 lakh cash
63.article_body: The Hyderabad Commissioner's Taskforce on Thursday busted an organised cricket betting racket and arrested the organiser. Police also seized ₹2.80 lakh cash, a mobile phone and car from his possession. According to police, the accused, identified as Mohammed Javed Khan, organised the betting from a flat in Gudimalkapur by watching cricket on apps in mobile phone.

64.title: 2 die in stampede at Lord Kallazhagar festival in Madurai; 7 hurt
64.article_body: Two people, including a woman, have died and over seven others were injured during the festivities of Lord Kallazhagar entering the Vaigai River in Tamil Nadu's Madurai on Saturday. The festival is being organised after a gap of two years. According to preliminary details, the stampede had occurred as people had entered the river against the district administration's orders.

65.title: Banned pro-Khalistan group SFJ chief booked for sedition in Gurugram
65.article_body: The chief of the banned pro-Khalistan group 'Sikhs for Justice' (SFJ) Gurpatwant Singh Pannun was booked by Gurugram Police on charges of sedition. This comes after he allegedly released a video asking people to raise the Khalistan flag at DC and SP offices in Haryana. Pannun purportedly stated that SFJ would launch the 'Haryana Banega Khalistan' campaign on April 29.

66.title: All permanent bans are failure of firm: Dorsey on Trump's Twitter ban
66.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey in response to a tweet questioning decision to ban former US President Donald Trump said, "I believe all permanent bans are...failure of the company. But likely right decision for the company." Media analyst Mark Dice had asked Dorsey if he thought it was "wrong" of Twitter to ban Trump and others who were "unfairly purged".

67.title: Those who wanted to send CM Yogi to Math will now face sticks: Aparna Yadav
67.article_body: BJP leader Aparna Yadav, who is the daughter-in-law of SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav, has commented on the opposition after the BJP's recent win in UP Assembly polls. "When I joined the BJP...some people had said that they have prepared to send (CM Yogi) Adityanath to the (Gorakhnath) Math. Now...it is time for them to face the sticks," Aparna said.

68.title: Angry over excess salt in food, man kills wife in Maharashtra
68.article_body: A man allegedly killed his 40-year-old wife at their residence in Maharashtra’s Thane district after he got angry over being served breakfast that contained too much salt. "The 46-year-old man strangulated his wife to death around 9.30 am after having his breakfast. He was angry as the 'khichadi' cooked by his wife contained too much salt," the police said.

69.title: 3 killed, 10 injured in road accident in UP's Firozabad
69.article_body: At least three people died and 10 others were injured after a mini-truck they were travelling in collided with a canter truck in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad, police said. The victims were returning from Etah after attending the last rites of a relative, police added. Three died on the spot and others were injured and hospitalised, police further said.

70.title: Took sabbatical after 'Kahaani..', was tired after doing 8 yrs of TV: Sakshi
70.article_body: Television actress Sakshi Tanwar said that she took a sabbatical after her first show 'Kahaani Ghar Ghar Ki' because she was tired after doing television for eight years. "I thought that I have done enough and this is it...I had seen name, fame, success with that one show...there was not much that I wanted beyond that," Sakshi added.

71.title: Prince Harry, Meghan visit Queen Elizabeth together for 1st time in 2 yrs
71.article_body: UK's Prince Harry and wife Meghan Markle visited Queen Elizabeth II at Windsor Castle on Thursday for the first time together since they stepped down as senior working royals in January 2020. Prince Harry and Meghan reportedly also met with Prince Charles during their visit. The couple stopped at Windsor on their way to the Netherlands for the Invictus Games.

72.title: Ranveer's 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' look inspired by Charlie Chaplin: Reports
72.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh's look and character traits in the movie 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' is inspired by Charlie Chaplin, Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. "A lot of thought process went behind creating this quirky character. The makers seem to have taken a leaf out of iconic actor of world cinema, Charlie Chaplin," the source was quoted as saying.

73.title: Actress Chhavi Mittal diagnosed with breast cancer, shares note
73.article_body: In an Instagram post, Actress Chhavi Mittal said that she has been diagnosed with breast cancer. "Dear breasts, This is an appreciation post for you...you fed both my babies. Today it's my turn to stand by you when one of you fights cancer," she wrote. "A big cheer for all breast cancer survivors," she added.

74.title: Don't believe any person or institution should own social media: Dorsey
74.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey while responding to Ethereum's Co-founder Vitalik Buterin on Tesla CEO Elon Musk's acquisition bid for Twitter said he doesn't believe "any individual or institutions should own social media or media firms". Buterin had tweeted, "Don't oppose Elon running Twitter...but I do disagree with the...generalised enthusiasm for wealthy people...takeover social media firms."

75.title: What do Cong, AAP fear will come out if 'The Delhi Files' is made: Shehzad
75.article_body: After filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri announced that he is working on 'The Delhi Files', BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawala asked why Congress and Aam Aadmi Party "feel rattled even before the announcement of its subject". "Why do they have problems with it? What do they fear will come out in the open if the film is made?" he added.

76.title: NITI Aayog to launch 'National Data and Analytics Platform' in May
76.article_body: NITI Aayog is planning to launch 'National Data and Analytics Platform (NDAP)' in May to provide government data in a user friendly format. According to officials, it will help researchers and policy-makers to easily analyse data. "The portal will have 200 datasets from more than 46 ministries at the time of...launch," said Anna Roy, senior adviser at NITI Aayog.

77.title: Threatened to withdraw molestation complaint, teen attempts suicide in Bengal
77.article_body: A teenage girl attempted suicide after her molesters, out on bail, threatened to kill her and her family if she did not withdraw her complaint in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri. She tried to set herself on fire out of fear, her family told police. The girl had filed a complaint of molestation in February against the accused, who are brothers.

78.title: Alia shares pics from mehendi ceremony, Ranbir seen carrying father Rishi's pic
78.article_body: Pictures from Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's mehendi ceremony have been shared by the actress on Instagram. "The Mehendi was like something out of a dream...a surprise performance by the ladkewalas...a BIG surprise organised by Mr Kapoor (my favourite artist performed my favourite songs)," she wrote. Ranbir was seen carrying his late father Rishi Kapoor's picture at the ceremony.

79.title: Pics of Mahesh Bhatt hugging Ranbir Kapoor on wedding day go viral
79.article_body: Pictures of Mahesh Bhatt hugging Ranbir Kapoor on the day of the latter's wedding with Alia Bhatt have gone viral. "Who needs words when one has the ability to listen & speak from the heart?" Pooja Bhatt wrote while sharing the pictures. "Oh my god, this breaks my heart," film critic Bhawana Somaaya commented.

80.title: PM Modi unveils 108-foot-tall statue of Lord Hanuman in Gujarat, shares pics
80.article_body: PM Narendra Modi unveiled a 108-foot-tall statue of Lord Hanuman in Gujarat's Morbi on Hanuman Jayanti. This statue is the second of the four statues being set up in the four directions across India, as part of #Hanumanji4dham project. It has been set up in the west, at the Ashram of Param Pujya Bapu Keshvanand ji in Morbi.

81.title: Wife of Putin ally claims her husband was beaten by Ukraine officials
81.article_body: Days after Ukraine arrested Viktor Medvedchuk, Russian President Vladimir Putin's closest ally in Ukraine, his wife Oksana Marchenko accused the Ukrainian security service of "beating her husband". Oksana, a former TV Presenter, said that one of two photos released by Ukraine of her husband after arrest shows "big bruise and marks which they have tried to conceal with his hair".

82.title: I cried for 2-3 hours thinking about my kids, wife: Sanjay Dutt on cancer diagnosis
82.article_body: Talking about his cancer diagnosis, actor Sanjay Dutt said that he cried for two to three hours after he got to know about it. "I was thinking about my kids and my life and my wife and everything," he added. "They told me that I'd lose hair...vomit, so I told the doctor 'nothing would happen to me'," he further said.

83.title: 12-yr-old killed in Odisha for not letting friends play games on mobile
83.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was killed with stones allegedly by his two friends on Thursday in Odisha's Koraput after he asked them not to play games on his mobile, police said. The accused disposed of the body on the bank of Kolab river, police added. The body was found a day later following a complaint by the deceased's father.

84.title: Death toll from storm Megi in Philippines rises to 167; 110 missing
84.article_body: The death toll from tropical storm Megi that struck the Philippines has risen to 167. Around 110 people are still missing, the government said. Megi, which made landfall on April 10, inundated many areas and set off landslides in several villages in Leyte province. Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte on Friday visited the province and handed relief goods to survivors.

85.title: Bluesky funding will be reviewed if Twitter owners change: Dorsey
85.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey in response to a Twitter user said Twitter's Bluesky initiative's funding would need to be re-assessed if Twitter ownership changes. A user had questioned Bluesky's "slow" progress and its future. "It has been slow, but this is an entirely new protocol in the open. They are slow but hopefully deliberate towards resilience," Dorsey said.

86.title: 2 men steal woman's purse, withdraw ₹1.2 lakh from account in Chandigarh; held
86.article_body: Two men have been arrested for allegedly stealing a woman's purse and withdrawing ₹1.26 lakh from her bank account in Chandigarh. They stole the purse, containing an ATM card and mobile phone from her car, and created a UPI ID using her SIM card to transfer the money into their accounts, police said. Police arrested them after launching a manhunt.

87.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 for duping DU professor of ₹1.5 lakh
87.article_body: The Delhi Police has arrested two men for allegedly duping a Delhi University professor of ₹1.5 lakh by offering him cancelled air tickets. The two accused were identified as Praveen Tiwari (34) and Rohit Kumar (34). Explaining their operation, police said the accused would initially book the tickets and later cancel them after receiving the money from the victim.

88.title: What's the use of good batters if MI give 14-16 runs an over: Azharuddin
88.article_body: Talking about MI, ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said, "They have a good batting line-up but what's the use of it if they're giving 14-16 runs per over." "MI have a very weak bowling side," added Azharuddin. MI, who have lost their last five matches in IPL 2022, are yet to record their maiden win. MI will take on LSG today.

89.title: It is sexual assault even if victim's breasts not developed: Calcutta HC
89.article_body: The Calcutta High Court while upholding a conviction for a sexual assault case said it was "absolutely immaterial whether breasts of a 13-year-old girl were developed or not", it was a violation as her body was touched with sexual intent. Accused of touching and kissing her inappropriately in 2017, the man had argued that the girl's breasts hadn't developed.

90.title: PM Modi inaugurates 108-foot Lord Hanuman statue in Gujarat's Morbi
90.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday unveiled a 108-foot statue of Lord Hanuman in Gujarat's Morbi via video conferencing on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanti. The statue is the second of the four statues being set up in four directions across India as part of the 'Hanumanji Char Dham' project. "Two more statues will be established in Rameswaram...West Bengal," PM said.

91.title: KTR inaugurates 1st phase of stent manufacturing unit near Hyderabad
91.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Friday inaugurated the first phase of the stent manufacturing unit of Sahajanand Medical Technologies (SMT) in Sangareddy near Hyderabad. The facility also has a Research & Development (R&D) unit which will employ over 300 highly qualified scientists, Rao said. He added that the manufacturing unit will generate employment opportunities for about 2000 people.

92.title: 11-year-old girl gets entangled in swing's wire in Bengaluru, dies
92.article_body: An 11-year-old girl died after she got entangled in her play swing's wire which was on the first floor of her house on Magadi Road in Bengaluru. Police have filed an unnatural death case. The girl's parents, who were reportedly on the ground floor when the incident occurred, took the girl to a hospital where she was declared brought dead.

93.title: Elderly woman 'locked up' at home for 10 yrs by sons in TN, rescued
93.article_body: An elderly woman was rescued from her house in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur on Friday after her sons allegedly locked her there for 10 years. The district's Social Welfare Department rescued the woman after a video of her purportedly lying naked surfaced on social media. The sons, a retired policeman and a government employee, had made arrangements for food, police said.

94.title: Such a knock by an ex-player must hurt: Ojha on Tripathi's 71 vs KKR
94.article_body: Discussing SRH batter Rahul Tripathi's 71 off 37 balls in the win against KKR, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said watching their former player perform like this must have hurt KKR. "KKR [may] be thinking that they made this player and gave him [an] opportunity," added Ojha. Tripathi's knock comprised four boundaries and six sixes.

95.title: Pollution in Yamuna impacted the water supply on Friday: Delhi Jal Board
95.article_body: A day after the ammonia concentration jumped to more than five times the treatable limit, pollution levels were brought under control in the Yamuna river and Delhi's regular water supply was restored on Friday evening. "The increased pollution resulted in operations being halved at the Wazirabad and Chandrawal treatment facilities on Friday (morning)," a Delhi Jal Board official said.

96.title: Struggling with my health, there are days when things get tough: SRH's Tripathi
96.article_body: Following his 37-ball 71 against KKR, SRH batter Rahul Tripathi said he was struggling with his health the last few days, adding that there are days when things get tough. "I am happy...I got this innings," added Tripathi who previously represented KKR. Tripathi has scored 171 runs in five IPL 2022 matches so far at a strike rate of 178.12.

97.title: 'Nude dance' organised at fair in Andhra Pradesh, police arrest 10 people
97.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Police have arrested ten people for organising 'nude dance' at a fair in Uppangala village. Police said that the incident took place on intervening night of April 14 and 15.  "A case has been registered and 10 people have been arrested," police said. Police added the people have been arrested based on a viral video.

98.title: Occupants 'luckily escape' after huge tree falls on 2 cars in Pune
98.article_body: Two cars and some two-wheelers were damaged after a huge Gulmohar tree fell on moving vehicles on Pune's Fergusson College Road on Friday, causing traffic congestion, officials said. "The occupants of two cars on whom the tree fell luckily escaped," a senior PMC fire officer said. The tree was cleared within 45 minutes, according to the fire brigade department.

99.title: Tiger offers his studio to 'India's Got Talent' contestants to practice stunts
99.article_body: Tiger Shroff offered Warrior Squad from 'India's Got Talent season 9' his own studio Fly Zone, where they can train for their stunts. According to Pinkvilla, he got so impressed by their performance that he decided to give them not only his studio but also his trainers. "What you have done for us...[is] very big," Warrior Squad's leader Rahul said.

100.title: Cooperating with insider trading probe: Call of Duty maker Activision
100.article_body: Call of Duty maker Activision Blizzard said it's cooperating with US government's investigations into trading by its CEO Bobby Kotick's friends right before the firm disclosed its sale to Microsoft, a filing showed. Barry Diller, David Geffen and investor Alexander von Furstenberg reportedly acquired share options after von Furstenberg met with Kotick days before the Microsoft sale was disclosed.

101.title: Woman searching for missing daughter raped by 3 waiters in Delhi
101.article_body: A 36-year old woman who was searching for her missing daughter was allegedly raped by three men working as waiters in West Delhi's Punjabi Bagh area, police said. The woman said that one of the men offered her help in finding her daughter but demanded that she accompany him and his two other friends to their rented accommodation.

102.title: Shut down your loudspeaker: MNS to Raut on comparing Raj Thackeray with Owaisi
102.article_body: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has put up posters outside Shiv Sena's Saamana newspaper office which read, "Whom did you call Owaisi? Sanjay Raut shut down your loudspeaker." This comes after Sanjay Raut said that BJP was using Raj Thackeray in Maharashtra similar to how it had used AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi in Uttar Pradesh during assembly elections.

103.title: Will never allow religious conversions but people need to be vigilant: Goa CM
103.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Friday said that the government will never allow religious conversions but people need to be vigilant. "The temple trusts in villages need to be vigilant, families need to be vigilant," he added. "Taking advantage of different things- someone is poor...somebody is backward...such people are being taken (in) in this manner," Sawant further said.

104.title: Went on 'Sanju' set 2-3 times, felt weird seeing myself in front of me: Sanjay
104.article_body: While talking about actor Ranbir Kapoor playing his role in 'Sanju', actor Sanjay Dutt said he went to set two-three times and that he felt weird seeing himself in front of him. "To see him being Sanjay Dutt and playing Sanju was amazing. It was fun," he added. He also said he would like to work with Salman Khan again.

105.title: Musk considering bringing in partners on his Twitter takeover offer: Report
105.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is speaking to investors who could partner with him on his Twitter acquisition offer, a report said. It said that Musk might be partnering with Silver Lake Partners, a private equity firm that was a potential investor when he considered taking Tesla private in 2018. Silver Lake's Co-CEO Egon Durban is already a Twitter board member.

106.title: Google, Wikipedia face fines over 'fake' content in Russia: Report
106.article_body: A Russian court has threatened Google and Wikimedia Foundation with fines for failing to delete "fake" information about the Ukraine conflict, Interfax reported. Earlier, Russian regulator Roskomnadzor urged Google to stop spreading "anti-Russian" content on YouTube. Russia had also blocked Instagram after Meta allowed Ukrainian users to post  messages such as "Death to the Russian invaders".

107.title: BJP felicitating those who launched a 'murderous attack' on CM: AAP
107.article_body: Criticising BJP for felicitating the eight accused who were arrested for vandalising Arvind Kejriwal's official residence, AAP's Manish Sisodia said BJP was felicitating those who launched a "murderous attack on the CM's house". "This proves that the BJP not only enlists goons but also promotes goondaism and rowdyism," Sisodia added. The eight BJYM members got bail from the High Court.

108.title: Punjab minister carries out surprise check of buses; 10 impounded
108.article_body: Punjab Transport Minister Laljit Singh Bhullar carried out surprise checks on buses in Jalandhar and Zirakpur on Thursday and Friday. As many as 10 buses were impounded during the checks and fines worth a total of ₹3.9 lakh were imposed. Bhullar also strictly instructed officials to take action against buses that are evading tax and being run without proper documentation.

109.title: UP to organise global investors' summit for ₹10 lakh crore investment
109.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath asked officials on Friday to organise a global investors' summit within next two years to attract an investment of about ₹10 lakh crore. UP had reportedly received ₹4.68 lakh crore of investment proposals during the last investors' summit in 2018. "Out of these, proposals of over ₹3 lakh crore are being realised on...ground," he added.

110.title: Delhi schools free to decide on partial or full closure if cases rise: Sisodia
110.article_body: Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister and Education Minister, Manish Sisodia, said schools in the national capital have the liberty to decide on partial or full closure if COVID-19 cases rise. "If any student...or...a teacher in a particular wing test positive, the wing or class should be temporarily closed," Sisodia said. "We haven't said the entire school should be closed," he added.

111.title: Overwhelmed: Kartik as fans in theatres cheer at his entry in 'Bhool...' teaser
111.article_body: The teaser of Kartik Aaryan's upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' was played in multiple theatres across the country. The actor took to Instagram on Friday to share some videos where his fans can be seen cheering and hooting at his entry in the teaser of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "Truly overwhelmed by the response #CinemasAreBack," Kartik captioned the post.

112.title: TV presenter and 'Gol Maal' actress Manju Singh passes away due to cardiac arrest
112.article_body: TV presenter and actress Manju Singh, who had featured in 1979 film 'Gol Maal' passed away due to cardiac arrest. Manju was also a producer and she had produced shows like 'Swaraj', 'Ek Kahani' and 'Show Time', among others. She was the anchor of the children's show 'Khel Khilone', which ran for seven years.

113.title: Some people take pictures with me first, later ask 'Are you an actor?': Rubina
113.article_body: Television actress Rubina Dilaik took to her Instagram Stories to say that some people first take pictures with her and later ask her which serial she works in. "And the best is 'Aap actor ho' [Are you an actor?]. I often get confused. Is it compliment or insult," Rubina added. Last year, she had reportedly called out her 'pseudo fans'.

114.title: Thousands rally in Serbia in support of Russia & against NATO
114.article_body: Thousands of Serbians marched through Belgrade to Russian Embassy to protest the government's bid to distance itself from Moscow after Ukraine invasion. Protesters were seen carrying Russian President Vladimir Putin's pictures, waving Russian and Serbian flags and chanting "No NATO", "Serbians and Russians are brothers". Serbia hasn't imposed sanctions on Russia but has voted against it in the UN.

115.title: ₹6.31-crore cash found hidden in beds of gutkha trader in UP, pics of raid surface
115.article_body: A Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) department team seized ₹6.31 crore in cash from beds of a gutkha trader in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur district. The team conducted raids at the gutkha trader's house and factory on Tuesday. The team got three note-counting machines from the SBI after finding the large amount of cash at the site.

116.title: 'Akhand Bharat' only when people from all castes live with unity: Gehlot to Bhagwat
116.article_body: Reacting to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's "India will become 'Akhand Bharat' in 10-15 years" remark, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said, "Akhand Bharat will be made when each person from all castes starts living with brotherhood and love." He further said that BJP and RSS are using names of Sardar Patel, BR Ambedkar and Mahatma Gandhi just for their political benefits.

117.title: Bag with evidence in a case against Andhra minister stolen from court
117.article_body: A bag containing evidence against Andhra Pradesh Agriculture Minister Kakani Govardhan Reddy in a forgery and defamation case was stolen from the fourth additional judicial magistrate's court in Nellore, police said. Govardhan in 2016 had accused then TDP minister Somireddy Chandramohan Reddy of amassing assets worth ₹1,000 crore, including properties in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand.

118.title: Philips and Virat Kohli talk about being #TenOnTenYou
118.article_body: Philips, along with Virat Kohli, has sparked a conversation about how the youth in India are constantly being judged by society. With this campaign, they aim to inspire the youth to ignore judgment and shape their true self, resonating with the Philips BT3000 beard Trimmer with Power Adapt Sensor, that adapts to the user’s unique style.

119.title: Mysterious liver disease detected in kids aged 1-6 in US, Europe; symptoms listed
119.article_body: A mysterious liver disease has been detected in kids aged 1-6 in US and Europe. This illness attacking only children has been brought to the notice of the World Health Organisation early this month, news agency AP reported. Symptoms of the disease include, jaundice, diarrhoea and abdominal pain. The disease has been so far reported to be severe.

120.title: Pune Metro footfall remains below 5,000 on weekdays in April: Report
120.article_body: The Pune Metro's ridership has reportedly dropped this month with figures not even crossing the 5,000-mark on weekdays falling between April 6 and 15. On March 6, the number of total riders was 37,752, which came down to 5,122 on April 6. However, the officials believe that numbers will increase once the total number of routes is increased.

121.title: Uddhav Thackeray's brother-in-law laundered ₹29.62 cr: Kirit Somaiya
121.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's brother-in-law Shridhar Patankar has laundered ₹29.62 crore through a company, BJP leader and former MP Kirit Somaiya said. "The company has constructed a building at Dadar's Shivaji Park...all the black money related to Thackeray's family has been parked in the company," he added. "CM should reply to these new facts that have emerged," Somaiya further said.

122.title: Alia Bhatt dances to 'Radha' with Karan Johar at her wedding after-party, video surfaces
122.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actress Alia Bhatt dancing to song 'Radha' from 2012 film 'Student of the Year' with filmmaker Karan Johar at her wedding after-party. Notably, Alia had made her acting debut in Bollywood with 'Student of the Year', which was co-produced by Johar's Dharma Productions. Alia got married to Ranbir Kapoor on April 14.

123.title: What is the 'poison pill' strategy adopted by Twitter against Musk's takeover offer?
123.article_body: Formally known as the shareholder rights plan, it's a defensive strategy used by companies against hostile takeovers. At Twitter, the plan will be triggered if any entity buys at least 15% of its stock in a purchase that isn't approved by its board. Following this, the entity's stake will be diluted as other shareholders will be offered discounted shares.

124.title: It's based on mythology of Vikram & Betal: Producer Neeraj on Vikram Vedha
124.article_body: Neeraj Pandey, who's backing Saif Ali Khan and Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Vikram Vedha', has said the upcoming film is based on the mythology of Vikram and Betal. "The film is a contemporary take. We were surprised how come...North Indian film has not taken it up," he added. The film is a remake of Madhavan and Vijay Sethupathi's Tamil film 'Vikram Vedha'.

125.title: Mob burns Muslim man's houses in UP after he elopes with Hindu girl
125.article_body: At least eight people were arrested on Friday after a mob allegedly set fire to two houses belonging to a Muslim man in Uttar Pradesh's Agra who had eloped with a Hindu girl. The 22-year-old girl claimed that she went with the man willingly. The mob, which included right-wing group members, accused the man of kidnapping the girl, police said.

126.title: Burglars break into house, steal ₹5 lakh in Ludhiana
126.article_body: Burglars broke into the house of Sumit Gupta, a cosmetic products trader in Ludhiana's Guru Nanak Pura and stole around ₹5 lakh on Tuesday. They also stole a wallet from his brother's car with ₹4,000 cash in it, Gupta said. As no cameras were installed outside the house, police are scanning the CCTVs in the area to trace the accused.

127.title: Twitter brings on JPMorgan as adviser amid Musk's acquisition offer: Report
127.article_body: Twitter has reportedly brought on JPMorgan Chase & Co. to help it respond to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion acquisition offer. As per a report, the bank recently started working to assist Twitter in talks with potential buyers. Meanwhile, Twitter has adopted a 'poison pill' strategy that prevents Musk from raising his stake in the company.

128.title: Will do everything to bring Uniform Civil Code: Shivpal Yadav
128.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia (PSPL) leader Shivpal Singh Yadav demanded the implementation of Uniform Civil Code and said, "We will do everything, even protest if needed, to fulfil the dream of Lohia and Ambedkar." "Ambedkar raised the issue of Uniform Civil Code in Constituent Assembly. Lohia had raised the issue too in Parliament. So we are supporting it," he added.

129.title: Actress Mohena, member of Rewa's erstwhile royal family, blessed with a baby boy
129.article_body: Actress Mohena Kumari Singh, who starred in the TV show 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai', and her husband Suyesh Rawat have been blessed with a baby boy. Mohena, who is a member of Rewa's erstwhile royal family, married politician and businessman Suyesh in October 2019. Mohena had also featured in 'Dance India Dance'.

130.title: Many buyers have agreed to pay in rubles for gas: Russia Deputy PM
130.article_body: Russia's Deputy PM Alexander Novak said that several buyers of Russian gas have agreed to switch to payments in rubles. "We expect the decision [to switch to rubles] from other importers," he added. Russian President Vladimir Putin had demanded "unfriendly countries" to pay for Russian gas in rubles after the West imposed severe sanctions on Moscow over the Ukraine invasion.

131.title: Pic of Russian woman who told soldier husband to 'rape Ukrainian women' released
131.article_body: The identities of a Russian soldier and his wife who discussed the rape of Ukrainian women in an intercepted phone call have been revealed following an investigation by Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty. The woman named Olga Bykovskaya told Roman Bykovsky to rape Ukrainian women amid the war, saying, "Don't tell me anything, understand...Just use protection."

132.title: 72-ft wide 'Glory Hole' opens up on US lake to drain excess water, pics surface
132.article_body: A gigantic 72-feet wide hole known as 'Glory Hole' has yet again opened up after the water level exceeded in the Lake Berryessa reservoir in the US. Built in the 1950s, 'Glory Hole' is a 75-metre-long tunnel that functions as a drain hole to swallow excess water. The hole appears to have a spinning vortex effect on the lake's surface.

133.title: Ranbir Kapoor hugs father-in-law Mahesh Bhatt on wedding day; pics surface
133.article_body: Actress Pooja Bhatt took to Instagram to share pictures of actor Ranbir Kapoor hugging filmmaker and father-in-law Mahesh Bhatt. "Who needs words when one has the ability to listen & speak from the heart?" she captioned the pictures. Pooja had earlier shared several pictures from the wedding, including that of the couple.

134.title: It lays bare Meta's hypocrisy: Apple on Meta's 47.5% metaverse tax
134.article_body: Apple has called out Meta's "hypocrisy" over its announcement to take a 47.5% cut from some developers selling digital goods on its metaverse platform, Horizon Worlds. It "lays bare Meta's hypocrisy", Apple said. "It goes to show that while they seek to use Apple's platform for free, they happily take from...creators and small businesses," an Apple spokesperson said.

135.title: Punjab man gets ₹5.62 lakh power bill for March, official says 'will check'
135.article_body: ID Singla of Punjab's Naya Gaon has received ₹5.62 lakh power bill for March. He said on an average, he pays around ₹5,000 to ₹6,000 a month for electricity. "I've been trying to contact PSPCL officials...but they are not responding," Singla said. Meanwhile, a PSPCL official said that the issue will be checked and sorted if any discrepancy is found.

136.title: Muslims are hurt when their children are attacked in pointless hate: Khurshid
136.article_body: Amid the Madhya Pradesh government's decision to bulldoze the houses of the accused in the Khargone violence, Congress leader Salman Khurshid has said that Muslims "are hurt when their children are attacked in pointless hate". "When the State chooses to bypass the rule of law and destroy homes and lives, what respect is left for patriotism?" Khurshid asked.

137.title: Supreme Court grants bail to accused suffering from HIV
137.article_body: Supreme Court granted bail to a man, accused in several criminal cases, after noting that he is suffering from HIV and appears to be immunocompromised. The patient has severe dyspnoea at rest and is unable to walk without support, the medical report stated. The petitioner is at liberty to claim anonymisation of the records to suppress his identity, SC stated.

138.title: Bodies of 900 people found in Ukraine's Kyiv
138.article_body: The bodies of more than 900 civilians have been discovered in the region surrounding the Ukrainian capital Kyiv following Russia's withdrawal, most of them fatally shot, police said on Friday. "Consequently, we understand that under the occupation, people were simply executed in the streets," police added. More bodies are being found every day, police further said.

139.title: India reports 975 COVID-19 cases, 796 recoveries in last 24 hours
139.article_body: India has reported 975 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,366, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,747. The country saw 796 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the ministry said.

140.title: Union Min Meghwal narrowly escapes as iron mast falls on stage in UP
140.article_body: Union Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal on Friday narrowly escaped after an iron mast with light fixtures fell on the stage due to strong winds during an extended Ambedkar Jayanti function in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. One person was killed and four were injured in the incident, ADM City said. The power supply to the area was also cut for some time.

141.title: Major fire breaks out at hosiery unit in Ludhiana, short circuit suspected
141.article_body: A major fire broke out at a hosiery unit near Ludhiana's Saidan Chowk at 10:30 am on Friday. "I suspect the fire broke out due to a short-circuit...the flames had engulfed the second and third floors of the building," the owner of Maharaja Collections, where the fire broke out, said. He added he suffered a loss of around ₹1.5 crore.

142.title: Children have right to love & affection of separated parents: Bombay HC
142.article_body: While hearing the petition of a 38-year-old father seeking temporary custody of his twin sons, the Bombay High Court said, "Children have the right to love and affection of both parents and grandparents." The petitioner who was granted four-day custody of his children told that his divorced wife did not allow him to meet his sons for nearly 22 months.

143.title: Ishq Vishk changed my life forever but I can't relate to 23-yr-old self: Shahid
143.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor who worked in his first Bollywood film 'Ishq Vishk' at age of 23, says that film changed his life forever. The actor, however, added he has changed tremendously and he can't even relate to his 23 year old self. "I don't know why...[I can't relate to...those years]...because beauty of life is to keep evolving...and changing," he added.

144.title: 22 held for cheating job seekers of over ₹1.25 cr in 6 months in Gurugram
144.article_body: As many as 22 people, including nine women, were arrested for running a fake call centre involved in cheating job seekers of over ₹1.25 crore in six months, Gurugram Police said. Police seized 21 computers, 27 mobile phones, one laptop and ₹38,000 in cash from the call centre. The accused used to run a fake website called placement.com, police added.

145.title: Drunk man fires 5 rounds at wife, children in Thane; detained
145.article_body: A 51-year-old man from Thane was detained by police on Friday for firing five rounds at his own wife and sons. According to police, Rajesh Sharma had returned home in a drunken state. He reportedly had an argument with his family members following which he opened fire from his licensed revolver. None of the family members was injured, police added.

146.title: Imran Khan seeks donation from overseas Pakistanis to topple new govt
146.article_body: Ousted Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Friday appealed to overseas Pakistanis to donate money to his Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party to topple the "foreign-backed" government of PM Shehbaz Sharif and hold new elections. Khan blamed the US for overthrowing his government and said he wanted the country to hold fresh elections where Pakistani citizens could decide on their future.

147.title: Utterly indefensible to not put this offer to vote: Musk on his Twitter bid
147.article_body: Replying to a user on Twitter possibly rejecting his offer, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "It would be utterly indefensible not to put this offer to a shareholder vote. They own the company, not the board of directors." The user had tweeted, "If the board of directors...reject the offer...wouldn't it be acting in...opposition to the financial interests of their shareholders?"

148.title: 'Mark Zuckerberg the 14th' will continue controlling Facebook: Musk
148.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk while discussing media ownership at TED conference commented on Mark Zuckerberg's share ownership at Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp, saying that even "Mark Zuckerberg the 14th" will "literally" be controlling the entities. Musk, who has made a $43 billion bid for Twitter, added, "We won't have that at Twitter."

149.title: K'taka govt is going after religious minorities: B'luru Archbishop
149.article_body: Bengaluru Archbishop Peter Machado told The Quint on Friday that the Karnataka government seems to "have an agenda and is going after the religious minorities". "First they went after Christians, and now they're going after...Muslims," he added. Furthermore, he also said that a meat ban on specific days is like "boycotting Christmas cakes because they're considered a Christian delicacy".

150.title: Kapoors, Bhatts told Panditji what to do, dad became director at wedding: Rahul
150.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's half-brother Rahul Bhatt said that the senior members of the Kapoor and Bhatt families were telling the pandit performing Alia and Ranbir's wedding rituals what to do. "After all it's a film family...like my dad he suddenly became a film director there as if he is directing a film," Rahul added.

151.title: Dale Steyn's reaction to Umran Malik's wicket-taking yorker goes viral
151.article_body: SRH fast bowling coach Dale Steyn's reaction to fast bowler Umran Malik taking KKR captain Shreyas Iyer's wicket with a yorker has gone viral. Steyn jumped out of his seat and celebrated the wicket with SRH spin bowling coach Muttiah Muralitharan. Steyn later revealed that Muralitharan had predicted that Umran would bowl a yorker to Iyer on that delivery.

152.title: 4 men follow steel trader for 282 kms to Mumbai, loot ₹15 lakh cash
152.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested four men from Nashik for allegedly following a 26-year-old steel and metal trader for 282 kilometres on their bike, from Malegaon to Mumbai, and robbing him of ₹15 lakh cash at knifepoint in Parel. The four robbers were tracking the Malegaon-based trader Shahrukh Khan's movement and figured out that he carried cash to Mumbai every Sunday.

153.title: Fashion influencer who started Rihanna-A$AP Rocky cheating rumour apologises
153.article_body: Fashion influencer Louis Pisano has issued an apology after tweeting that Rihanna and A$AP Rocky had broken up after the rapper was "caught cheating" on the singer with shoe designer Amina Muaddi. "Last night I made a dumb decision to tweet some information I had received," Pisano wrote. "I apologise to them for this unnecessary drama," Pisano added.

154.title: VJ-actor Cyrus Sahukar marries longtime girlfriend Vaishali Malahara, pic surfaces
154.article_body: VJ, host and actor Cyrus Sahukar tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Vaishali Malahara on Friday. The wedding, that took place in Alibaug, was attended by Shruti Seth, Mini Mathur, Kabir Khan, Sahil Sangha and Devraj Sanyal, among others. Cyrus and Vaishali started dating each other over six years ago.

155.title: US-based Thoma Bravo contacts Twitter with acquisition offer: Report
155.article_body: US-based private equity firm Thoma Bravo has contacted Twitter and is putting together an acquisition offer that could rival Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid, as per a report. While it isn't yet clear as to how much Thoma Bravo will offer, a source said that the company could be a white knight for Twitter and CEO Parag Agrawal.

156.title: Mumbai's TIFR asks staff not to post anti-govt content on social media
156.article_body: Mumbai's Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR) has instructed its staff and their family members not to post any anti-government content on social media. The institute has also asked employees to refrain from posting pictures and videos of institute facilities on social media platforms like Facebook and WhatsApp. It added that such activities could lead to "serious security consequences".

157.title: Man kidnaps wife on suspicion of her character in Pune; 3 arrested
157.article_body: Pune police have arrested a man and his two associates for allegedly kidnapping his wife, as he suspected her character and wanted to murder her. The woman raised an alarm and threw her phone when the accused forcefully put her in a car, following which a passer-by informed police. Police learnt that the accused were in Phaltan and caught them.

158.title: Hyd Police share pic of congested road, urge public to follow traffic rules
158.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police took to Twitter to share a picture of a congested road with several vehicles standing haphazardly. "Follow traffic rules! Breaking traffic rules causes inconvenience to you and others too," police wrote on Twitter. A Twitter user, in the comments section, asked if 3 days imprisonment can be given to those who drive on wrong side.

159.title: Punjab announces 300 units of free power for households from July 1
159.article_body: Bhagwant Mann-led Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government in Punjab has announced 300 units of free power for households from July 1. This comes after Mann on Tuesday said his government will soon give "good news" to the people of Punjab. Providing free electricity to every household for up to 300 units was one of the poll promises made by AAP.

160.title: Woman murders 3-month-old daughter after fight with husband in Delhi
160.article_body: A 26-year-old woman allegedly strangled her three-month-old daughter to death after a fight with her husband at their residence in Delhi's Haiderpur area, police said. "She had a quarrel with her husband...over some domestic issue. When he left for work, she killed the baby in a fit of rage by pulling the thread worn around her neck," police added.

161.title: Man gets messages to pay off loan he didn't take, asks Hyd Police for help
161.article_body: A Twitter user shared screenshots of WhatsApp chats, claiming that he has been getting messages from "loan apps" to pay off the loan that he claimed he did not take from them. While tagging the Hyderabad Police in his tweet, he wrote, "Please help me sir. I'm getting these messages daily." Hyderabad Police asked him to approach nearest police station.

162.title: Woman dies after stray bull attacks her with its horns in Noida
162.article_body: A 55-year-old woman died after being attacked by a stray bull outside her house in Noida's Phase 1 on Friday morning. The woman was walking towards a shop to buy food for her children when the bull charged at her and attacked her with its horns, police said. The bull reportedly attacked her again when she fell down on road.

163.title: 8 accused of attacking Kejriwal's house garlanded at BJP Delhi office
163.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Thursday welcomed and garlanded eight BJYM workers, who were arrested on March 31 in connection with the attack on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house, at the party office. Gupta said they were jailed while protesting against "anti-Hindu" Kejriwal. "Each of our workers will always fight against anti-Hindu forces," he tweeted.

164.title: 11 persons were drunk during protest at Pawar's house: Mumbai Police
164.article_body: Mumbai Police said on Friday that 11 people, who participated in the protest by MSRTC employees outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's house last week in Mumbai, were drunk. The police had taken the samples of 81 people. Police added that on April 7, a meeting was held at advocate Gunaratna Sadavarte's house and 20-25 people participated in it.

165.title: Rahul Tripathi slams 71(37) as SRH defeat KKR to register their 3rd win in a row
165.article_body: SRH defeated KKR by seven wickets to register their third consecutive victory in IPL 2022 and move to the seventh position on the points table. KKR, who have now lost two matches in a row, dropped to the fourth position. Rahul Tripathi's 71(37) and Aiden Markram's 68(36) helped SRH chase down 176-run target in 17.5 overs.

166.title: Sorry guys, really wanted to play: Deepak Chahar after being ruled out of IPL 2022
166.article_body: After being ruled out of IPL 2022 due to a back injury, CSK fast bowler Deepak Chahar took to Instagram to pen a note. He wrote, "Sorry guys...Really wanted to play but will come back better and stronger like I have always done. Thanks for always supporting me with your love and wishes. Need your blessings."

167.title: Robot that can be controlled remotely to treat stroke patients made by MIT
167.article_body: Engineers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have developed a telerobotic system that can help doctors remotely treat patients experiencing a stroke or aneurysm using a modified joystick. The robotic arm has a magnet attached to its wrist and its orientation can be adjusted to guide a magnetic wire through the patient's arteries and vessels to remove blood clots.

168.title: China's Xi'an imposes partial lockdown to fight COVID outbreak
168.article_body: The local government in China's Xi'an city on Friday said that it will impose a partial lockdown from April 16 to April 19 after reporting dozens of COVID-19 infections this month. The announcement comes as a surge in coronavirus cases continues in other parts of the country. Residents should largely keep their movements within residential compounds, the government added.

169.title: From holding your tiny hands to seeing you as a bride: Alia's bodyguard on her wedding
169.article_body: Alia Bhatt's bodyguard Sunil Talekar posted a photo of himself with the actress and actor Ranbir Kapoor after their wedding ceremony. "From holding your tiny hands to seeing you as a bride I can say my heart is filled with happiness today," he wrote in the caption. "Cutest caption ever," an Instagram user commented.

170.title: If I was an Indian selector, I'd keep close eye on SRH's Natarajan: Vaughan
170.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said if he was an Indian selector then he'd be keeping a close eye on SRH pacer T Natarajan. "Looking at India, I think they'd be silly not to look at him," he added. Natarajan, who last played for India over a year ago, has taken 11 wickets from five matches in IPL 2022 so far.

171.title: Russia expels 18 European Union diplomats from Moscow
171.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry on Friday expelled 18 European Union diplomats from the country. Notably, the move comes after 19 Russian diplomats were ordered to leave the EU on April 5. "The EU is responsible for the consistent destruction of the architecture of bilateral dialogue and cooperation that had taken decades to form," the ministry said in a statement.

172.title: Video of US President Joe Biden's handshake in 'thin air' goes viral
172.article_body: A video of US President Joe Biden's handshake in 'thin air' has gone viral. After finishing his speech at the North Carolina Agricultural & Technical State University, Biden turned and appeared to shake hands with 'thin air'. He looked apparently lost for a moment before walking off the stage. Some social media users said that his actions were being misinterpreted.

173.title: Situation of hosting Asia Cup in SL to be assessed on final day of IPL: Shah
173.article_body: Asian Cricket Council President and BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said situation of hosting Asia Cup 2022 in Sri Lanka will be assessed on final day of ongoing IPL. Sri Lanka is battling a severe economic crisis with food and fuel scarcity affecting the population. Asia Cup is scheduled to be hosted in Sri Lanka from August 27 to September 11.

174.title: WhatsApp emoji reactions soon to make their debut
174.article_body: Emoji reactions will be among the latest upcoming features on WhatsApp, as has been confirmed by Will Cathcart, Head of WhatsApp, in a tweet. He also announced the launch of several other features such as communities, larger file sharing, up to 32 participants on audio calls and greater admin control. The emoji reactions are also features of Instagram and Telegram.

175.title: Met Congress rebel MLAs, formed 'Team Sidhu': Navjot Singh Sidhu
175.article_body: After reports claimed that rebel Congress MLAs were planning to leave the party, former Punjab Congress President Navjot Singh Sidhu said that he held a meeting with rebel MLAs where 'Team Sidhu' was formed. 'Team Sidhu' will look into the problems raised by party MLAs, Sidhu said. "I will continue to fight for the interests of Punjab," he added.
