176.title: 46-yr-old man beaten to death over monetary dispute in Jharkhand
176.article_body: Police investigating the death of a 46-year-old man, whose body was found at a dhaba near NH98 in Jharkhand's Palamu on Wednesday, believe he was beaten with a stick. The deceased, Pappu Shondik, had reportedly lent ₹10 lakh to dhaba owner who gave him two cheques in return. However, after the cheques bounced, Pappu pressured him to return the money.

177.title: Young women put sexualised images, but it's not their fault: Sonam
177.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor has stated that she sees a lot of her young colleagues who are catering to an audience by putting out highly sexualised imagery, adding that it's not their fault. "If I put a sexy photo of myself on Instagram, it's got like 10 times more likes than a picture of me in a pretty dress," Sonam said.

178.title: SBI to hire business consultant for prospects in EV space
178.article_body: India's largest public sector lender SBI has decided to hire a consultant to explore business opportunities for digital payments in the electric vehicle (EV) charging segment. The consultant will need to identify market potential, develop a strategic roadmap and provide recommendations on the next steps and areas for support through investments, said SBI in a request for proposal (RFP) document.

179.title: Twitter adopts 'poison pill' rights plan to block Musk's $43 billion takeover bid
179.article_body: Twitter is adopting a limited duration shareholder rights plan, often called a 'poison pill', after the world's richest man Elon Musk offered to buy the company for $43 billion. Under this plan, if any person or group acquires at least 15% of Twitter's stock without the board's approval, other shareholders will be allowed to purchase additional shares at a discount.

180.title: ₹1.90 cr unaccounted cash seized from 2 bus passengers in Andhra
180.article_body: Police in Andhra Pradesh on Friday recovered unaccounted cash worth ₹1.90 crore from two passengers travelling on a bus during a routine check. The accused have been arrested, police said. "The two could not produce any documentation for [the cash], therefore it was declared unaccountable cash and will be handed over to the Income Tax department," police added.

181.title: B'deshi teenager arrested for sneaking into India to buy chocolate
181.article_body: A Bangladeshi teenager was arrested for illegally crossing into India to buy chocolate from Sipahijala in Tripura, BSF officials said. Eman Hossain hails from a village next to a river that marks the international border between India and Bangladesh. He used to sneak through a hole in the barbed wire fencing to buy chocolate, but was caught on April 13.

182.title: 150 Palestinians injured in clashes with Israeli police in Jerusalem
182.article_body: More than 150 Palestinians were wounded in clashes with Israeli riot police inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound on Friday. Most of the injuries were incurred by rubber bullets, stun grenades and beatings with batons, the Palestine Red Crescent Society said. The Israeli police claimed that the clashes began after the Palestinians began hurling stones and firecrackers at security forces.

183.title: Death toll from floods in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal rises to 395
183.article_body: The death toll from flooding in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal Province rose to 395 on Friday. The floods have knocked out power lines, shut down water services and disrupted operations at port of Durban, one of Africa's busiest ports. Earlier, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa had visited the flood-hit parts of the province and promised to provide support to affected communities.

184.title: Bihar CM opens ₹550-crore soft drink bottling plant at Begusarai
184.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday opened a soft drink bottling plant, which is said to be worth ₹550 crore, at Asurari in Begusarai. State Industries Minister Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said the Pepsi bottling plant of Varun Beverages Limited would generate employment and give preference to locals. He further announced that 17 ethanol units would be opened soon in Bihar.

185.title: Man dies by suicide in Telangana hospital after son denied job
185.article_body: A 46-year-old man, who was undergoing treatment at a Telangana hospital, allegedly died after consuming pesticide on Thursday. He reportedly did so as his family was unable to pay hospital bills of ₹60,000 after his son was denied a job. The deceased's son had earlier been promised a job by authorities while acquiring his land for Kakatiya Thermal Power Project.

186.title: Sri Lanka starts rationing fuel amid severe economic crisis
186.article_body: Sri Lanka's state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has announced it would ration fuel to the public from Friday, amid a severe economic crisis in the country. Buses, lorries and commercial vehicles have been exempted from the measure. Earlier this week, Sri Lanka had declared that it is defaulting on its $51 billion external debt.

187.title: PM Modi to unveil 108 ft Lord Hanuman statue in Gujarat tomorrow
187.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will unveil a 108 feet statue of Lord Hanuman on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanti in Gujarat's Morbi on Saturday. "This is the second of the four statues being set up in the four directions across India, as part of the #Hanumanji4dham project," informed the Prime Minister's Office. The first statue was set up in Shimla.

188.title: Twitter adopts shareholder rights plan after Musk offers to buy it for $43 billion
188.article_body: Twitter is adopting a limited duration shareholder rights plan, often called a 'poison pill', after the world's richest man Elon Musk offered to buy the company for $43 billion. Under this plan, if any person or group acquires at least 15% of Twitter's stock without the board's approval, other shareholders will be allowed to purchase additional shares at a discount.

189.title: Russian Defence Minister suffers heart attack, says businessman
189.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu has suffered a massive heart attack that may not have occurred from natural causes, exiled Russian businessman Leonid Nevzlin has alleged. Nevzlin also said that Shoigu is "out of the game" and could be left disabled if he survives and is currently in intensive care. He added that 20 generals have been arrested amid war.

190.title: Shaheen shares pics from Alia-Ranbir wedding, says 'Our weird tribe got weirder'
190.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's sister Shaheen Bhatt on Friday took to Instagram to share pictures from Alia's wedding with Ranbir. She wrote, "My two favourite people in the world got married yesterday and our weird, happy little tribe just got a whole lot weirder and happier." The couple got married in an intimate ceremony on April 14 at Ranbir's Vastu residence.

191.title: Soni Razdan gifts son-in-law Ranbir watch worth ₹2.5 crore: Report
191.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's mother Soni Razdan gifted her son-in-law actor Ranbir Kapoor a watch worth ₹2.5 crore at Alia and Ranbir's wedding on Thursday, reported Hindustan Times. It is reportedly a high-end watch which is from a brand that is not easily available. The wedding guests received Kashmiri shawls as a gift which were picked by Alia, the report added.

192.title: Burnley sack manager Sean Dyche amid PL relegation battle
192.article_body: Burnley on Friday announced they have parted company with manager Sean Dyche as the club struggles to avoid relegation from the Premier League this season. Dyche, 50, was the longest serving manager in the Premier League having been in charge of Burnley for nine-and-a-half seasons. Burnley are currently 18th on the Premier League table with 24 points.

193.title: West Ham Utd beat Lyon 3-0 to reach UEFA Europa League semi-finals
193.article_body: West Ham United on Thursday beat French side Olympique Lyonnais 3-0 to win their quarter-final tie 4-1 on aggregate to reach the semi-finals of the UEFA Europa League. Craig Dawson, Declan Rice and Jarrod Bowen scored the goals for the Premier League club. West Ham will face Eintracht Frankfurt in the semi-finals. The first-leg will take place on April 28.

194.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy is massive, getting very similar to Ashes: Lyon
194.article_body: Calling Border-Gavaskar Trophy "massive", Australia spinner Nathan Lyon said, "It's getting very similar to an Ashes series as pinnacle series for an Australian cricketer." He added, "This series with the World Test Championship on the line as well is going to be even more important and probably a bigger challenge." Since 2017, India have won three Border-Gavaskar trophies.

195.title: Bihar proposes to get 2,500-year-old wall UNESCO heritage site tag
195.article_body: According to Bihar's Art, Culture and Youth department, the state government has sent a proposal to the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) to get a 2,500-year-old wall at Rajgir, listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The 40 kms wall of stone was reportedly built before third century BC around the city of Rajgir to protect it from invaders.

196.title: Egypt has approved India as wheat supplier: Piyush Goyal
196.article_body: World's top wheat importer Egypt has approved India as a wheat supplier, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced on Friday. The development comes amid a sharp decline in availability of wheat in global markets due to the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, who are both major wheat exporters. Egypt is looking to import 1 million tonne of wheat from India.

197.title: Nothing will be achieved by painting JNU saffron: RJD's Manoj Jha
197.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal MP Manoj Kumar Jha condemned the 'Bhagwa JNU' posters and putting up of saffron flags outside Jawaharlal Nehru University campus. He said, "What will happen if the saffron flag is planted in JNU? This is a university. Understand the university's global philosophy. Nothing will be achieved by colouring university saffron, green, red and yellow."

198.title: Sarpanch shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Baramulla
198.article_body: An independent sarpanch, identified as Manzoor Ahmad Bangroo, was shot dead by terrorists at the Goshbugh area of Baramulla district in Jammu and Kashmir, police said on Friday. "He was shifted to hospital where doctors declared him brought dead," police added. His murder was condemned by L-G Manoj Sinha who said, "Perpetrators of this despicable act shall be punished."

199.title: Russia says it hit Ukrainian arms factory after sinking of Russian ship
199.article_body: Russia on Friday said its forces had struck a factory in Kyiv that made and repaired Ukrainian missiles. The attack comes after Ukraine claimed its missile strike had sunk the flagship of Russia's Black Sea fleet, Moskva, this week. However, Russia did not confirm that Ukrainian missile strikes had hit the ship.

200.title: KKR's Nitish Rana smashes SRH's fridge with a 69-metre six, video goes viral
200.article_body: KKR batter Nitish Rana smashed a six on the bowling of SRH fast bowler Umran Malik, in the 13th over, which went on to smash the fridge in the SRH dugout. The distance recorded for the maximum was 69 metres. Rana scored 54 runs off 36 deliveries in the innings. It was his 14th fifty in IPL.

201.title: Amber Heard once spit in my face when I asked for higher salary, claims former assistant
201.article_body: A former personal assistant to Amber Heard said the actress once spit in her face when she asked for a higher salary. Kate James said she was paid "very poorly" and that she was hired at an initial salary of $25 an hour. She added she never saw Heard suffer any physical abuse at the hands of then-husband Johnny Depp.

202.title: K'taka minister, booked for contractor's alleged suicide, resigns
202.article_body: Days after he was booked for a contractor's alleged suicide, BJP leader and Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa handed over his resignation to CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Friday. He said he was resigning "to prevent embarrassment to the BJP". The deceased contractor, Santhosh Patil, claimed Eshwarappa and his aides demanded a 40% commission to clear his nearly ₹4 crore bill.

203.title: He takes brave decisions for GT: Rashid on Hardik's captaincy
203.article_body: GT spinner Rashid Khan has praised Hardik Pandya for keeping the team environment "amazing" under him, saying the captain always takes the "brave" decisions. "He's someone who is very clear in mind on what he is going to do...he has been delivering the best so far and leading from the front– (be it) batting, bowling and fielding," he added.

204.title: World no. 3 Zverev beats Carreno Busta to reach Monte Carlo Masters QFs
204.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev on Thursday defeated Pablo Carreno Busta 6-2, 7-5 to reach the quarter-finals of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. "To win the biggest tournaments in the world, like Masters series, like Grand Slams, you have to be aggressive," the 24-year-old German said. Zverev reached the quarter-finals in Monte Carlo for the second time.

205.title: 8 accused of attacking Kejriwal's house garlanded at BJP Delhi office
205.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Thursday welcomed and garlanded eight BJYM workers, who were arrested on March 31 in connection with the attack on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house, at the party office. Gupta said they were jailed while protesting against "anti-Hindu" Kejriwal. "Each of our workers will always fight against anti-Hindu forces," he tweeted.

206.title: BJP govt did more work for STs than Oppn did in 6 decades: Bhatia
206.article_body: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia on Friday said the BJP government did more work for Scheduled Tribes than what the Opposition did during their nearly six-decade-long rule. Bhatia said, "PM Modi emphasised on Eklavya Model Residential School for better education of children of SC/ST society." Under the scheme, 452 new schools will be built in the next five years, Bhatia added.

207.title: Konkani should also be used in Bombay HC proceedings in Goa: CM
207.article_body: The Goa government has decided to write to the Bombay High Court seeking to list the Konkani language, in addition to English, to conduct all the court proceedings in Goa. Goa CM Pramod Sawant said, "It will be our endeavour to ensure that the court should function in English as well as in Konkani."

208.title: Respect him for this: BJP's Locket on TMC leader's 'woman CM' remark
208.article_body: Commenting on TMC leader Saugata Roy's "woman CM" remark, BJP MP Locket Chatterjee on Friday said she respects him for this statement. She added, "This is exactly what we were saying. Other TMC members should also speak...truth." Roy had said it's a "matter of shame" if crimes against women take place in a state where a woman is the CM.

209.title: It wasn't bird poop that fell on Biden, it was corn: White House on video
209.article_body: White House Communications Director Kate Bedingfield has issued a clarification after a video appeared to show that bird poop fell on US President Joe Biden's suit during his speech in Iowa recently. "If you guys knew your way around a corn silo at all, you'd know it was corn," she tweeted while sharing the video.

210.title: PM Modi greets people of Himachal Pradesh on its statehood day
210.article_body: PM Narendra Modi today greeted Himachal Pradesh's people on its statehood day. He said the state has converted challenges into opportunities, reiterating the commitment to take development to every inhabitant of Himachal during 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'. He added the state has to be developed at a quick pace to take it ahead in fields like tourism and higher education.

211.title: N Chandrasekaran implements management reshuffle at Air India
211.article_body: After the recent acquisition of Air India by Tata Group, Air India and Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran has conducted a major reshuffle in the airline's senior management. Veteran Meenakshi Mallik has been replaced by Nipun Aggarwal as the Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) and Suresh Dutt Tripathi will succeed Air India's Amrita Sharan as the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO).

212.title: Nepal's foreign exchange reserves are running low: Official
212.article_body: Nepal's foreign exchange reserves are running low and will run out in seven months if things don't improve, a spokesperson for the Central Bank of Nepal said on Friday. The reserves are needed to import medicines, oil products, cars and a range of other items in the Himalayan nation. Currently, Nepal's government has restricted imports of non-essential goods.

213.title: We're going to see him back on court again: Roddick on Federer
213.article_body: After Roger Federer shared pictures of himself training in gym as he continues his knee rehabilitation, ex-world number one Andy Roddick said everyone is going to see the 20-time Grand Slam champion back on court again. "He wouldn't post something like this unless he's confident in his recovery," he stated. Federer had a third right knee surgery in August 2021.

214.title: Fans organise Alia-Ranbir's 'Bengali wedding' in Kolkata, pics viral
214.article_body: Fans of Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor organised a 'Bengali wedding' for the couple in Kolkata using cutouts of their faces on life-size dolls. The bride and groom dolls arrived at a special ceremony at Ballygunge 21 Pally cultural club on hand-pulled rickshaws. Pictures from the ceremony have gone viral on social media. Alia and Ranbir got married on Thursday.

215.title: It was a proud moment for me, my family: GT pacer Dayal on his IPL debut
215.article_body: Speaking about his IPL debut against RR in ongoing tournament, GT pacer Yash Dayal said it was a "proud moment" for him and his family. "It's a big thing for me for the kind of background I come from...I was a bit nervous but I controlled it," he added. The 24-year-old posted bowling figures of 4-0-40-3 in the match.

216.title: RSS should merge with BJP and become political party: Rajasthan CM
216.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) should merge with BJP and become a political party. He added that "RSS works to make BJP win by staying behind" and they should now come forward. Gehlot's comments come after RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that 'Akhand Bharat' will become a reality in 15 years.

217.title: India will talk non-violence but also carry a stick: RSS chief Bhagwat
217.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, while addressing a gathering of saints in Haridwar on Wednesday, said India will talk about non-violence but will also carry the stick as "the world only understands power". He further said that India's journey of progress has begun and "those who want to stop it will be either removed or finished, but India will not stop".

218.title: 6 killed after jeep crashes into truck on Rajasthan highway
218.article_body: Six members of a family were killed after a jeep carrying nine people crashed into a truck on the Jaipur-Jodhpur national highway on Thursday. According to police, the jeep got stuck in the truck after the collision resulting in the death of three people on the spot. The other three died in hospital while the injured were shifted to Jodhpur.

219.title: Ranbir pays tribute to Rishi, wears his watch worth ₹21 lakh on wedding
219.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor paid a tribute to his father late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor at his wedding with actress Alia Bhatt by wearing his watch worth ₹21 lakh. The watch reportedly comes with an 18 karat white gold case with a blue alligator leather strap. The couple got married on April 14 in an intimate ceremony at Ranbir's Vastu residence.

220.title: England Women pacer Anya Shrubsole retires from international cricket aged 30
220.article_body: England's 2017 Women's World Cup-winning pacer Anya Shrubsole announced her retirement from international cricket aged 30. "I feel immensely privileged to have been able to represent my country for the past 14 years," she said. Shrubsole bagged nine wickets in the 2022 Women's World Cup. Notably, she was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in the 2017 Women's World Cup final.

221.title: Pregnant Rihanna breaks up with boyfriend A$AP Rocky after he cheats on her: Report
221.article_body: Rihanna's fans have reacted amid claims that she was cheated on by boyfriend A$AP Rocky, with whom she's expecting her first child. A fashion influencer tweeted that they broke up after she found him cheating on her with Amina Muaddi, who's currently employed at Rihanna's clothing line Fenty. "Cheating on a woman pregnant with your child is...inhumane," a person wrote.

222.title: Musk can buy Sri Lanka, call himself Ceylon: Snapdeal CEO shares viral text
222.article_body: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl took to Twitter to share a viral WhatsApp forward after Elon Musk offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion. "He can buy [Sri Lanka's debt] and call himself Ceylon Musk," Bahl said. Sri Lanka is facing its worst economic crisis since the 1940s and recently declared it is defaulting on its $51 billion external debt.

223.title: If harmed, India won't spare anyone: Defence Minister on standoff with China
223.article_body: While speaking about Ladakh standoff with China in US, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said, "I cannot say openly what they (Indian soldiers) did...But I can definitely say that a message has gone that India will not spare anyone if harmed." India believes in having a bilateral relationship which is based on win-win for both the countries, he added.

224.title: Senco Gold files draft papers for ₹525 crore IPO
224.article_body: Jewellery retailer Senco Gold and Diamonds has filed draft papers with the SEBI to raise ₹525 crore through an IPO. The offer comprises fresh issue of equity shares of up to ₹325 crore and an offer for sale of shares worth ₹200 crore. Senco plans to use net proceeds from IPO towards funding working capital requirements and general corporate purposes.

225.title: I cried a lot, baby is only 12 days old: Bharti Singh on returning to work
225.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh posed for journalists as she returned to work on Friday. In a video shared by a journalist account, she can be heard saying that she cried a lot and her baby is only 12 days old. "Lekin kaam kaam hai (But work is work)," she added. Bharti and husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa welcomed a son on April 3.

226.title: SRH to bowl first against KKR, Ajinkya Rahane dropped by KKR
226.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against KKR in their IPL 2022 clash on Friday. KKR have made three changes to their playing XI, with Aaron Finch, Aman Khan and Sheldon Jackson replacing Ajinkya Rahane, Rasikh Salam and Sam Billings. Rahane has been dropped after scoring 80 runs in five innings.

227.title: Wave of inclusivity in H'wood shouldn't be taken for granted: Regina
227.article_body: Actress Regina Hall has stated that the wave of inclusivity in Hollywood shouldn't be taken for granted, adding there will always be room for change and inclusivity and it will always remain a work in progress. "Look at what (writer-director) Mariama Diallo did with...'Master'...[touching] upon the issue of race, gender...Having a film like that is evidence of change," Regina said.

228.title: Hyd Police officers help family change punctured car tyres at 1 am
228.article_body: Two Hyderabad Police officers on patrol in the city's Ambedkar Nagar area on Thursday helped a stranded family, after spotting them stuck in their car due to punctured tyres at around 1 am. "Mr Rajesh and Mr Narender not only checked...safety of my family but also lent...helping hand in changing tyres," wrote Sunil Jain, the person who was stuck.

229.title: Bulldozers raze riots-accused's properties in Guj's Khambhat
229.article_body: The Gujarat government on Friday used bulldozers to raze properties allegedly belonging to those accused of violence on Ram Navami in Khambhat, a video of which has surfaced. "We have been given directions by DM and SP to remove unauthorised structures that are causing hurdles in the commute of people to maintain a peaceful environment," SDM Khambhat Nirupa Gadhvi said.

230.title: MMRDA to set up museum dedicated to Mumbai Trans-Harbour Link
230.article_body: The MMRDA will set up a museum dedicated to the Mumbai Trans-Harbour Link, one of the longest sea bridges in the country. The museum will showcase the construction timeline, obstacles, technology, and engineering method used in an audiovisual format. The 21.8-km-long sea link that'll connect South Mumbai with Navi Mumbai is being built at an estimated cost of ₹18,000 crore.

231.title: Ram wasn't God, Tulsidas-Valmiki created this character: Ex-Bihar CM
231.article_body: Former Bihar CM and Hindustan Awam Morcha chief has said Ram wasn't a God but a character created by  Tulsidas-Valmiki. "They created 'kavya' and 'mahakavya' with this character...It states a lot of good things and we revere that...I revere Tulsidas-Valmiki but not Ram," he added. Manjhi claimed there are only two castes in the world - rich and poor.

232.title: Video shows huge crowd as chariot festival begins in Madurai
232.article_body: The annual chariot festival pulled up a huge crowd in Madurai, Tamil Nadu near the Meenakshi Amman Temple. In a video, thousands of devotees can be seen around the temple. The festival, which is celebrated during the Tamil month of Chithirai, was not observed for the last two years due to coronavirus pandemic.

233.title: 235 electricity feeders under load shedding in Pune district
233.article_body: At least 235 electricity feeders in the Pune district are under load shedding, according to a report. "Currently, load shedding is in a few parts of Manchar and Rajgurunagar. Load shedding is taking place along the power line where people haven't paid their bills," an official said. Notably, the government has imposed load shedding in several parts of the state.

234.title: 2 women prisoners get pregnant after having sex with transgender inmate in US jail
234.article_body: Two inmates serving time in a women-only prison in US' New Jersey got pregnant allegedly after having consensual sex with a transgender inmate. The state Department of Corrections has said that the women had consensual sexual relationships with another incarcerated person. Meanwhile, 27-year-old transgender prisoner Demitrius Minor has claimed online that he got the two women pregnant.

235.title: Mama will rebuild the houses burnt in Khargone violence: MP CM
235.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan assured action against Khargone violence culprits and said that those whose houses were burnt in the violence, need not worry. He said, "Their Mama will re-build their houses." On April 10, during Ram Navami procession, clashes broke out, where several houses and vehicles were set on fire.

236.title: Don't fall into BJP's trap, vote for AAP in Himachal polls: Sisodia
236.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has urged residents of Himachal Pradesh to vote for the AAP in the upcoming state Assembly elections, cautioning them against falling into the BJP's trap. Sisodia accused the BJP of announcing freebies out of the fear of losing the state polls. "BJP has never believed in...concept of providing things to people at...cheaper rate," he added.

237.title: World War 3 has now begun, says Russian state TV
237.article_body: World War 3 has already started, said Russia's state TV following the sinking of the Russian warship Moskva. Olga Skabeyeva told Rossiya 1 channel viewers that "what it's escalated into can safely be called World War 3" and insisted "that's entirely for sure". "Now we're definitely fighting against NATO infrastructure, if not NATO itself," she added.

238.title: KKR's Umesh has everything in his arsenal right now: Irfan Pathan
238.article_body: Talking about Umesh Yadav, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said the KKR pacer has everything in his arsenal currently. "He's bowling outswing...brilliant inswingers and his rhythm is perfect...he's putting up a show in this season for KKR who showed faith in him," he added. Umesh, with 10 wickets from five matches, is the second highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022 so far.

239.title: Anil thanks Delhi Police for catching thieves who stole from Sonam's Delhi home
239.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor on Friday thanked Delhi Police for catching the culprits who stole from his daughter actress Sonam Kapoor and her husband Anand Ahuja's Delhi residence. He wrote on Twitter, "Shoutout to @DelhiPolice for their diligence and hard work at solving crimes in the city. Grateful for their service in solving the robbery case at Ahuja home so promptly."

240.title: Hyd Police issues traffic advisory over Hanuman Jayanthi on Saturday
240.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Friday announced traffic diversions in the city for Saturday due to 'Hanuman Jayanthi Vijaya Yathra'. The main procession will start at 11.30 am from the Gowliguda Ram temple and proceed towards the Tadbund Hanuman temple. The procession will cover a 12-km distance and is expected to conclude at about 8 pm.

241.title: SDPI worker killed in front of father in Kerala, party blames BJP-RSS
241.article_body: A 44-year-old worker of SDPI, the political wing of PFI, was allegedly killed in front of his father in Kerala's Palakkad district on Friday. The deceased, Subair, was returning from Friday prayers with his father when a car hit their bike. A four-member gang emerged from another car and attacked him. The party has blamed BJP-RSS for his death.

242.title: He still is game's best role model: Vaughan after Root quit Test captaincy
242.article_body: After Joe Root stepped down as England's Test captain, Michael Vaughan tweeted, "Root gave it everything with very little support for...red ball team under his watch." He added, "He still is and will (be)...game's best role model for many many years...now enjoy being the senior player for many more seasons." With 27 wins, Root is England's most successful Test captain.

243.title: Jasprit Bumrah is the best cricketer in Asia currently: Mohammad Kaif
243.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif named pacer Jasprit Bumrah as the best player currently in Asia, terming him as a "very cool" and composed player who delivers under pressure. "People talk a lot about batters from Virat Kohli to MS Dhoni," said Kaif. Kaif added that Pakistan captain Babar Azam does not get enough appreciation for his performances.

244.title: Home isolation COVID-19 cases rise by 48% in 1 week in Delhi
244.article_body: There has been a nearly 48% increase in home isolation COVID-19 cases in one week in Delhi, official data suggests. On April 8, 388 patients were in home isolation and on April 14, 574 patients were in home isolation. After Delhi reported 325 new cases on Thursday, the active COVID-19 cases in the city rose to 915.

245.title: Woman beats up Swiggy delivery boy with shoes on a busy road in MP; video viral
245.article_body: A video showing a woman beating up a Swiggy delivery boy with shoes on a busy road in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur is going viral on social media. The incident reportedly took place after the bike of the delivery agent, who was coming from the wrong side, collided with her scooty. "I have been injured," the woman said in the video.

246.title: Alia wanted her kaleeras small, delicate: Designer Mrinalini Chandra
246.article_body: Designer Mrinalini Chandra has revealed that actress Alia Bhatt wanted her bespoke wedding kaleeras small and delicate. "You can't tell what's going on...It is for them to know. They want the people to keep guessing...It reflects their personality," she added. Alia got married to Ranbir Kapoor on Thursday at his Vastu residence. Her kaleeras and mangalsutra featured the infinity symbol.

247.title: Incredible how SRH read games, they've used resources better than KKR: Ojha
247.article_body: Discussing the upcoming match between SRH and KKR, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said SRH have utilised their resources better than KKR, adding that the way they read games is pretty incredible. SRH are currently on the eighth spot on the IPL 2022 points table, while KKR are second. "This is going to be a good competition," added Ojha.

248.title: Really surprised to see MI not showing faith in ₹8.25-cr buy David: Jaffer
248.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted that he is "really surprised" to see Mumbai Indians (MI) not showing faith in all-rounder Tim David, who was bought for ₹8.25 crore in IPL mega auction. "Surely he's good enough to play more than a couple of games," Jaffer added. David has scored 13 runs in two IPL 2022 matches.

249.title: Barcelona crash out of Europa League after losing to Eintracht Frankfurt
249.article_body: Barcelona have been knocked out of Europa League after losing the quarter-final 3-4 on aggregate against Eintracht Frankfurt. After the first leg ended in a 1-1 draw, Eintracht Frankfurt defeated Barcelona 3-2 in the second leg at Camp Nou. Eintracht Frankfurt scored their three goals in the second leg before Barcelona could even open their account.

250.title: First COVID-19 case of IPL 2022 confirmed as DC physio Patrick Farhart tests positive
250.article_body: The first COVID-19 case of IPL 2022 has been confirmed as Delhi Capitals (DC) physio Patrick Farhart tested positive for the virus. The IPL said in a statement that the Australian is being closely monitored by the DC medical team at the moment. DC are scheduled to face RCB on Saturday.

251.title: Lewandowski 'definitely' staying at Bayern Munich next season: CEO Kahn
251.article_body: Bayern Munich CEO Oliver Kahn said striker Robert Lewandowski will "definitely" be staying at the club next season. "We would be stupid to sell a player who scores 30 to 40 goals per season," Kahn said. Lewandowski's contract with Bayern Munich expires next summer. Lewandowski has won the Bundesliga title with Bayern Munich five times so far.

252.title: According to BJP, only Hindus were harmed in Karauli violence: Owaisi
252.article_body: AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi has alleged that "according to the BJP, only Hindus were harmed" in the communal clashes which took place in Rajasthan's Karauli. "A minister of Rajasthan government said that a total of 80 shops were burnt in Karauli, out of which 73 belonged to Muslims," Owaisi said. He further alleged that Muslims were targeted by "Sangh rioters".

253.title: I'll come out innocent, will become minister again: KS Eshwarappa
253.article_body: Karnataka Minister for Rural Development and Panchayat Raj KS Eshwarappa, who is slated to resign today after his name figured in a contractor's alleged suicide case, has said he'll be proven innocent and will become a minister again. "If I continue as a minister when the investigation is on, there'll be a feeling that I may influence it," he said.

254.title: Dimitrov beats world no. 7 Ruud to reach Monte Carlo Masters QFs
254.article_body: Grigor Dimitrov on Thursday beat world number seven Casper Ruud 6-3, 7-5 to reach the quarter-finals of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. "I just played and enjoyed the game," Dimitrov said after winning in one hour and 31 minutes. Dimitrov, in his ninth appearance at the tournament, last reached the semi-finals in Monte Carlo in 2018.

255.title: Earthquake of magnitude 3.5 hits Odisha's Ganjam
255.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 3.5 on the Richter scale hit Odisha's Ganjam district at 11:19 am on Friday, an official of the Bhubaneswar Meteorological Centre confirmed. The epicentre of the earthquake was 203 km south of Rourkela. Its depth was 10 km inside the earth's crust. No casualty or major damage has been reported.

256.title: KKR will have to remove Rahane as well if they drop Billings: Parthiv
256.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said that KKR will have to remove Ajinkya Rahane as well if they drop Sam Billings from the lineup, to bring in a wicketkeeper. Rahane has scored 80 runs in five IPL 2022 matches at a strike rate of 100. Meanwhile, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha stated that KKR will stick with Rahane who is experienced.

257.title: Ukraine to face Scotland in World Cup qualifying play-off SF on June 1
257.article_body: UEFA and FIFA on Thursday said in a statement that Ukraine's World Cup qualifying play-off semi-final against Scotland has been rearranged for June 1. The match was initially due to be played on March 24 but was postponed following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The winner between Ukraine and Scotland will face Wales in the play-off final on June 5.

258.title: Over 27.5 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since war began
258.article_body: More than 27,57,000 people have entered Poland from Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on February 24, Chancellery of the PM of Poland said on Friday. Around 26,800 people had entered the country from Ukraine on Thursday. Reportedly, the number of people crossing the border into Poland has fallen significantly in recent weeks and numbers going into Ukraine have risen.

259.title: Cyrus Sahukar to tie the knot, shares videos from pre-wedding festivities
259.article_body: VJ-actor Cyrus Sahukar and his longtime girlfriend, actress Vaishali Malahara are all set to get married in Alibaug. According to reports, the couple celebrated their mehendi function on Thursday. He took to his Instagram Stories to share some videos and pictures of the pre-wedding festivities, where he can be seen posing with Mini Mathur, Kabir Khan and Samir Kochhar.

260.title: Actress Pooja Hegde joins 'F3' shoot for a special song
260.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde has joined Telugu film 'F3: Fun and Frustration' for a special dance number. Taking to Twitter, director Anil Ravipudi shared a picture of the actress from the back. Starring Venkatesh Daggubati and Varun Tej in the lead roles, 'F3' is bankrolled by Sri Venkateswara Creations. It will release in theatres on May 27.

261.title: Jesus Christ's ideals are guiding light for people: PM on Good Friday
261.article_body: On the occasion of Good Friday, PM Narendra Modi remembered the sacrifices of Jesus Christ. Taking to Twitter, PM Modi said, "We remember the courage and sacrifices of Jesus Christ today on Good Friday...His ideals of service and brotherhood are...guiding light for several people." Notably, Good Friday is a Christian religious holiday commemorating the crucifixion and death of Jesus Christ.

262.title: Musk offered to buy my firm too: Journalist while sharing his experience
262.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk offered to acquire Twitter, journalist Conrad Quilty-Harper spoke about the time when Musk offered to buy the science magazine he worked for in 2019. While Musk didn’t acquire the company, Conrad shared aspects such as trusting your social media manager, auditing the Twitter following and interaction with Musk, etc, as the takeaways from the incident.

263.title: Mamata can't question character of victim: WB BJP chief on Nadia rape case
263.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar criticised CM Mamata Banerjee for her "rape or love affair" remark on the alleged rape of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia district and said, "Case should be registered against the CM." "She (Mamata Banerjee) can't question the character of the victim," he added. Her comments have "ashamed the Bengali community", he further said.

264.title: Patient attacks doctor with scissors in ICU of Delhi hospital: Police
264.article_body: A 40-year-old patient attacked a doctor with a pair of scissors in a Delhi hospital on Friday, police said. The incident occurred when the doctor came into the ICU to treat the patient, who was hospitalised to get rid of alcohol addiction and occasional fits, according to police. The doctor reportedly suffered minor injuries in his hand during the incident.

265.title: 38-yr-old climber dies on Mt Everest, was found in a sitting position
265.article_body: Ngimi Tenji Sherpa, a 38-year-old Nepali climber who summited Mount Everest several times, has died on the peak, expedition organisers said. He was carrying equipment uphill to Camp 2 and was found in a sitting position, still wearing his backpack. "His body has been brought down. There were no accidents, and initial medical check suggests high-altitude sickness," an official said.

266.title: Shot in real cockpit, was tough to shoot in confined space: Rakul on Runway 34
266.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, who'll be seen alongside Ajay Devgn in the film 'Runway 34', has revealed that they shot for the film in a real cockpit. "We got a real simulator...every button that you see is real. So whatever we were pressing was real," she added. Rakul further said it was tough to shoot in a confined space.

267.title: Wrestling is our oldest sport, not including it in CWG 2026 is wrong: Bajrang
267.article_body: Olympic bronze medallist Bajrang Punia has criticised the decision of dropping wrestling from the initial sports programme list for the Commonwealth Games 2026. "The Commonwealth Games Federation will decide but the decision...is wrong to keep wrestling, shooting and archery out. Wrestling is our oldest sport in the Games and keeping it out is not right," said the 28-year-old wrestler.

268.title: He's one of the best batters in IPL: GT pacer Ferguson on Buttler
268.article_body: Praising Jos Buttler, GT pacer Lockie Ferguson said the RR opener is one of the best batters in IPL. "The way he was batting (against GT), there's not a lot you can do when a guy's batting that well," he added. Ferguson bowled a yorker to dismiss Buttler (54) in GT's 37-run win against RR in IPL 2022.

269.title: My conclusion, Musk is f****** with SEC: Cuban on his Twitter bid
269.article_body: US billionaire investor Mark Cuban while discussing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's Twitter bid, said, "My conclusion, Elon Musk is f****** with...SEC." "His filing with the SEC allows him to say he wants to take a company private for $54.20," Cuban wrote, comparing the bid to Musk's tweet about taking Tesla private at $420 that landed him in trouble with SEC.

270.title: Hyd's EFLU to help develop communication skills of IAS trainees
270.article_body: The English and Foreign Languages University (EFLU) in Hyderabad has signed an MoU with the Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration (LBSNAA) to teach and refine the professional communication skills of IAS trainees. The pact will enable the university to design and offer intensive training programmes to the trainees. EFLU called the signing of the MoU a "momentous occasion".

271.title: I'd go on field after watching video of Rohit batting, can call it superstition: Jitesh
271.article_body: Punjab Kings (PBKS) wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma, who was with Mumbai Indians in 2016 and 2017, revealed that he used to go on the field after watching video of Rohit Sharma batting. "You can call this a superstition maybe, but this is what I would do before getting down to playing. I genuinely enjoy watching him bat," Jitesh added.

272.title: CSK's ₹14-crore buy Deepak Chahar ruled out of IPL 2022
272.article_body: Pacer Deepak Chahar, who was bought by CSK for ₹14 crore in mega auction, has been ruled out of IPL 2022. The 29-year-old fast bowler was recovering from a quadriceps tear at NCA in Bengaluru to get fit for IPL 2022. However, he suffered a fresh injury in his back, which has made him unavailable for the entire tournament.

273.title: India will become 'Akhand Bharat' in 10-15 yrs: RSS chief Bhagwat
273.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said India will become 'Akhand Bharat' in 10-15 years. He made the comment in response to Akhil Bharatiya Akhara Parishad chief Mahant Ravindra Puri's statement that astrological predictions suggest the Akhand Bharat dream will be realised in 20-25 years. "You spoke about 20-25 years, but if we increase our speed, I say 10-15 years," Bhagwat added.

274.title: France to 'very soon' move its embassy in Ukraine back to Kyiv
274.article_body: France will "very soon" move back its embassy in Ukraine to the capital Kyiv from the western city of Lviv, French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian told his Ukrainian counterpart Dmytro Kuleba during a call. The embassy was moved to Lviv last month as conditions worsened on the ground after Russia invaded Ukraine. Russian forces have reportedly withdrawn from Kyiv.

275.title: Using rummy to explain integers wrong: PMK leader on class 6 maths chapter
275.article_body: Former Union Minister and Pattali Makkal Katchi leader Anbumani Ramadoss urged the Tamil Nadu government to remove integers chapter from the class 6 mathematics book. "The motive of the integers chapter might be to explain numbers to students...Using a rummy game to explain integers is wrong, it will not teach numbers but only how to play rummy," he said.

276.title: Viral video shows woman casually talking on phone right after train passes over her
276.article_body: A video of a woman calmly talking on her phone right after a train passed over her has gone viral. The video was posted on Twitter by IPS officer Dipanshu Kabra. "Gossiping on the phone is more important," Kabra said in his Twitter post accompanying the video. "Pick her up and put her behind bars," a Twitter user commented.

277.title: Blood money is being used to purchase Russian oil: Zelenskyy
277.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy accused European countries which continue purchasing Russian oil of "earning their money in other people's blood". Zelenskyy criticised Hungary and Germany for preventing an oil embargo. "We don't understand how you can make money out of blood," he said. "The US, the UK, some European countries, they are trying to help and are helping," he added.

278.title: Cardi B, Offset share 1st pics of 7-month-old son, name him Wave Set Cephus
278.article_body: Cardi B and her rapper-husband Kiari Kendrell Cephus, professionally known as Offset, took to their respective Instagram accounts to share the first pictures of their 7-month-old son. "Wave Set Cephus," Offset captioned the picture as he revealed the name of their son. "When [Offset] suggested Wave, I was sold! THAT HAD TO BE HIS NAME," Cardi wrote on Twitter.

279.title: Ranbir wanted that I explain all rituals during wedding: Pandit Rajesh Sharma
279.article_body: Pandit Rajesh Sharma, who performed nuptials at Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding ceremony, said that Ranbir wanted him to explain all rituals in the wedding. "Ranbir and I recently met at Shamshera's muhurat. That is when he said you will perform my wedding rituals," Sharma said, adding that the wedding ceremonies concluded by 5:20 pm on April 14.

280.title: K'taka AAP demands arrest of state minister KS Eshwarappa
280.article_body: The Karnataka unit of AAP has demanded state Minister KS Eshwarappa's arrest in connection with the death of contractor Santosh Patil. "The resignation alone of KS Eshwarappa is not enough, he should be arrested immediately and all the scams in his...department must be thoroughly investigated," said AAP state President Prithvi Reddy. Notably, Congress has also demanded the BJP leader's arrest.

281.title: Bangladeshi teen sneaks into India to buy chocolate, arrested
281.article_body: A Bangladeshi teen was arrested in Tripura for illegally crossing into India, the Border Security Force said on Friday. The accused would regularly swim across Shalda river and enter India to buy his favourite Indian chocolate from a shop in Kalamchoura village. He would sneak through a hole in the barbed wire fencing and would return home the same way.

282.title: Hardik Pandya gets entangled facing spinners: Wasim Jaffer
282.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said GT captain Hardik Pandya gets "entangled" while facing spinners as he has not batted at the number four position before IPL 2022. "There is...pressure on Shubman Gill to spend more time on the crease and [he] is doing the bulk of the scoring," added Jaffer. "GT are dependent on...two to three batters," stated Jaffer.

283.title: Elon is distracted, he's got a lot going on: Tesla investor exec
283.article_body: Amid the ongoing news surrounding Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion offer to buy Twitter, Tesla investor Loup Ventures Managing Partner Gene Munster said, "Elon is distracted. He's got a lot of things going on. He's involved in a lot of different endeavours." "This is a one to three months headwind to Tesla's stock," he added.

284.title: Don't know who is saying so: Hardik denies reports of leaving Cong
284.article_body: Gujarat Congress leader Hardik Patel has denied rumours of him leaving the party. "There is a rumour that I am leaving Congress, I do not know who is spreading so," Patel said. "There will be small fights...within the party, but we have to work together to make Gujarat a better place," Patel, who joined the Congress in March 2019, said.

285.title: 60-yr-old ex-serviceman killed in hit and run accident in Mohali
285.article_body: A 60-year-old ex-serviceman was killed in a hit and run accident near Dappar toll plaza in Mohali's Lalru on Wednesday evening. Identified as Muni Ram, the victim was crossing the road near Gurpreet Dhaba at 9:15 pm when a Toyota Innova coming from Ambala hit him. He was rushed to a civil hospital where he succumbed to his injuries.

286.title: COVID-19 cases, deaths drop to lowest levels yet in Africa: WHO
286.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Thursday said the number of COVID-19 cases and deaths reported in Africa has dropped to its lowest levels since the pandemic began. WHO said less than 20,000 new cases and 239 deaths were reported in the last week, a decline of 29% and 37% respectively compared to the week before.

287.title: IMD predicts fresh spell of heatwave in Delhi, Haryana and Rajasthan till April 19
287.article_body: The IMD has warned of a severe heatwave sweeping across parts of Rajasthan from April 17 to 19 and over Delhi, Chandigarh and Haryana on April 18 and 19. The IMD announced on Friday that these regions are experiencing the third heatwave of this season. This comes after a prolonged heatwave spell came to an end nearly three days ago.

288.title: Bengaluru Police chief to hold Q&A session on Twitter tomorrow
288.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said that he will hold a live question and answer (Q&A) session on Twitter with the city's residents on Saturday.  The city police chief has asked people to share their grievances, ideas and suggestions with him using the hashtag #AskCPBlr. Notably, the session will be held from 11 am to 12 pm.

289.title: Twitter weighs 'poison pill' strategy to prevent Musk from raising stake: Report
289.article_body: Twitter's board is considering adopting a 'poison pill' strategy to prevent Elon Musk from raising his stake in the company significantly, Bloomberg reported. The strategy allows existing shareholders to buy more shares at a discount, effectively diluting the hostile party's stake. In a TED interview, Musk said "there's a plan B" if Twitter rejects his offer to buy the company.

290.title: Body of student killed in Canada to be brought to India tomorrow
290.article_body: The body of 21-year-old Kartik Vasudev, who was shot dead in Canada, will be brought to Delhi on Saturday, his father Hitesh Vasudev said on Friday. "Toronto Police has said that the accused has been produced before the court and has been asked to hire a lawyer because of which next hearing is on April 20," his father added.

291.title: Glad it happened with a senior like Ashwin: Dasgupta on being retired out
291.article_body: Reacting to Ravichandran Ashwin being retired out in RR's match against LSG, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Deep Dasgupta said he is glad it happened with a senior player like Ashwin. "[Retiring out] can be easily done and should be done...We can see it more in the future," added Dasgupta. "The game is going towards...clarity of thought and specialisation," stated Dasgupta.

292.title: Canada to deploy 150 troops to Poland to support refugees: Anand
292.article_body: Defence Minister Anita Anand on Thursday said Canada will deploy 150 military personnel to Poland to support Ukrainian refugees fleeing Russia's invasion. "Our people will provide general support, spiritual services and limited medical care enabled by Ukrainian-speaking Canadian Armed Forces personnel," she said. Over 4.6 million people have fled Ukraine since the invasion began on February 24.

293.title: Must be careful of EV push, it raises dependency on few nations: BMW
293.article_body: BMW CEO Oliver Zipse warned firms of the EV push, adding there was still a market for combustion engine cars. "When you look at the technology coming out, the EV push, we must be careful because at the same time, you increase dependency on very few countries," Zipse said. He highlighted that China mostly controls battery raw materials' supply.

294.title: Mumbai Dabbawalas take 5-day break 1st time after 2 years of COVID-19
294.article_body: Mumbai Dabbawalas have gone on a five-day break for the first time after two years of the COVID-19 pandemic to celebrate the Dev Khandoba Festival. 95 per cent of the dabbawalas have reportedly reached their villages for the celebrations since Tuesday. Reports said that dabbawalas will be returning to duty by April 18.

295.title: Museum director calls for Parthenon marbles to be returned to Greece
295.article_body: The new director of the Acropolis Museum in Athens Nikos Stampolidis has called for the Parthenon marbles to be returned to Greece. The fifth century marbles were passed to the British Museum in 1817 after being stripped from the Parthenon temple in Athens in the early 1800s. The Parthenon temple was built to honour the patron goddess of Athens.

296.title: Ranbir, Alia won't have a wedding reception: Choreographer Rajendra Singh
296.article_body: Choreographer Rajendra Singh said in an interview that Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt will not host a wedding reception. "There's no reception. There must be rumours going on, but there's no reception," he said, adding, "Ranbir is shooting, Alia is working...Maybe tomorrow they have some house pooja, I've no idea. But as far as I know, there's no reception."

297.title: 2 killed, over 200 homes destroyed in wildfire in New Mexico
297.article_body: New Mexico State Police on Thursday said two people have been killed and over 200 homes have been destroyed by a wildfire in the US state of New Mexico. Officials said the blaze began on Tuesday. "We're trying to keep this fire as small as possible, especially because it's right in the community," Incident Commander Dave Bales said.

298.title: Desperate Putin may use low-yield nuclear weapons: US spy chief
298.article_body: The US Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) Director William Burns warned that Russia's setbacks in its invasion of Ukraine could lead "desperate" President Vladimir Putin to resort to using a tactical or low-yield nuclear weapon. He added that the threat of Russia potentially using nuclear weapons "cannot be taken lightly", although there is little practical evidence to reinforce such a concern.

299.title: South Korea to drop most COVID-19 restrictions from next week
299.article_body: South Korea will drop most of its COVID-19 restrictions from next week including a midnight curfew on restaurants, coffee shops and indoor businesses. Authorities will also remove a 10-person limit on private social gatherings. Health Minister Kwon Deok-cheol on Friday said an outdoor mask mandate could be dropped over the next two weeks. Wearing of masks indoors will remain required.

300.title: 5 men gangrape tribal girl in West Bengal's Birbhum district
300.article_body: A tribal girl was allegedly gang-raped by five men in a village located in West Bengal's Birbhum district. According to the police, the incident took place when the minor and her boyfriend were returning home from a village fair. The five accused beat up the girl's boyfriend and then took turns to rape her, police said.

301.title: 5 arrested for gang-rape in Jharkhand's Ranchi
301.article_body: Five of the six accused of gang-raping a woman in Jharkhand's Ranchi were arrested on Thursday, police said. The search operation to arrest the sixth accused is on, police added. "The victim was on her way home with one of the accused when midway the accused called five of his friends...all of them allegedly raped the victim," police further said.

302.title: Air India starts restoring salaries, allowances to pre-pandemic levels
302.article_body:
With the aviation sector recovering due to the decline in COVID-19 cases, Air India is restoring salaries and various other allowances of its employees in a phased manner to pre-pandemic levels. 
As per Air India’s document, for the cabin crew and pilots, the flying allowance, special pay and wide-body allowance will be restored to pre-pandemic levels starting April 1.

303.title: U'khand cabinet gives nod to set up panel to draft Uniform Civil Code
303.article_body: The Uttarakhand cabinet has given nod to set up a panel comprising legal experts and stakeholders to work on the implementation of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the state. "Keeping our pre-poll promise, we cleared a proposal to constitute a committee to draft Uniform Civil Code at the very first meeting of our cabinet," CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said.

304.title: No citizen should face problems during rainfall in B'luru: BBMP chief
304.article_body: BBMP chief Gaurav Gupta has directed officials to attend to areas where complaints of waterlogging and traffic are reported in Bengaluru. Directing that no citizen should face problems during the rainfall, he said, "BBMP...should immediately reach places where trees/branches have fallen or wherever...rainwater gets blocked." There's a forecast of continued rain for the next three days in the city.

305.title: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari inaugurates open-air theatre in Pune
305.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari inaugurated an open-air theatre at the Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute in Pune on Thursday. "I can imagine how satisfied and joyous those behind this open-air theatre are now that it is ready," Gadkari said at the event. Notably, the open-air theatre is built at the cost of ₹7 crore, entirely funded by the Firodia Trust.

306.title: Shouldn't bulldozers be used against those who trouble the poor: MP CM
306.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, while reacting to criticism from opposition over the demolition of houses of people accused of pelting stones in Khargone, asked, "Shouldn't bulldozers be used against those who trouble the poor?" "This government is softer than a flower for the public, but we will not let goons and criminals survive in the state," Chouhan added.

307.title: Residents in parts of Pune complain of water supply shortage
307.article_body: Residents in parts of Pune have recently complained of a shortage in the supply of water. Some residents have blamed mismanagement by authorities for the situation. "There is no pressure; we have to climb down four floors to get water from a common tap, which runs for 30 minutes and then we...have to buy water from tankers," a resident said.

308.title: Pic shows gathbandhan ceremony from Ranbir Kapoor & Alia Bhatt's wedding
308.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor's sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni took to Instagram Stories to share pictures of the gathbandhan ceremony from his wedding with Alia Bhatt. In the pictures, Ranbir's cousin Karisma is seen helping the couple tie the knot while Riddhima and Kareena are seen assisting. Ranbir and Alia got married in an intimate wedding ceremony on Thursday.

309.title: 1 dead, several injured in stone-pelting incident at temple in Odisha village
309.article_body: One person was killed and several others sustained injuries at a stone-pelting incident that took place between two groups from Durgaprasad and Deulapali villages in Odisha, during the 'Danda Yatra' on Friday, Nayagarh ASP said. He added that a case has been registered and the situation is under control. The incident took place at a Shiva temple in Sindhuria village.

310.title: Kangana Ranaut is a professional but I was extra careful with her: Arjun Rampal
310.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal, who shared screen space with actress Kangana Ranaut in 'Dhaakad', said that she is a complete professional but that he was "extra careful" with her. "I think we both got some great chemistry going on set", Rampal said, adding, Kangana had tested COVID positive during shoot of the movie and it had taken a toll on her.

311.title: Sundar's injury a big blow, Williamson's strike rate a concern: Manjrekar on SRH
311.article_body: Talking about eighth-placed SRH, ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said that all-rounder Washington Sundar's hand injury, due to which he might miss upcoming two matches in IPL 2022, is a "big, big blow" to the franchise. He further said that SRH captain Kane Williamson's strike rate is a concern for the team, which will face KKR tonight.

312.title: Speak on inflation and not loudspeakers in mosque: Aaditya tells Raj Thackeray
312.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray reacted to the ongoing loudspeaker row and said, "Instead of removing loudspeakers, one should use the same to speak about rising inflation." "One should speak about petrol, diesel or CNG," he added. His statement comes after Raj Thackeray said, "Loudspeakers at mosques should be shut by May 3rd otherwise, we will play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers."

313.title: RR are always trying to question the status quo: Watson on Ashwin retiring out
313.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin becoming the first player to retire out in IPL, DC assistant coach Shane Watson said, "RR are always trying to question the status quo." Watson, however, stated that DC players won't get retired out, adding, "How do you learn as a batter to work through if you've a couple of balls where you aren't scoring runs?"

314.title: Vivek Agnihotri announce he is working on new film 'The Delhi Files'
314.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri on Friday tweeted that it is time for him to work on a new film 'The Delhi Files'. He wrote, "I thank all the people who owned #TheKashmirFiles. For last 4 yrs we worked very hard with utmost honesty & sincerity...It's important to make people aware of the GENOCIDE & injustice done to Kashmiri Hindus."

315.title: Kapoor saab, your wish has been fulfilled: Neetu on Ranbir's picture as groom
315.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor shared a picture of her and late actor Rishi Kapoor's son and actor Ranbir Kapoor as a groom after his wedding with actress Alia Bhatt. "This is dedicated to Kapoor saab. Your wish has been fulfilled," she wrote. Neetu had earlier shared pictures of the newly-wed couple on Instagram.

316.title: Delhi govt to form panel to consider revision of auto & taxi fares
316.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot has announced the formation of a committee to consider the revision of auto and taxi fares. Earlier, auto, taxi and cab drivers' associations warned the authorities to go on a strike from Monday if their demand for subsidy on gas prices wasn't met. Notably, CNG price was hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi yesterday.

317.title: Ranbir gets Alia's name written on hand with mehendi, pic viral
317.article_body: Pictures showing actor Ranbir Kapoor's heart-shaped mehendi design on his palm with wife Alia Bhatt's name are going viral on social media. The couple made their first appearance after their wedding on Thursday at Ranbir's Vastu residence. Alia's mehendi design featured an infinity symbol which is significant to their relationship. She also had the symbol in her mangalsutra and kaleera.

318.title: 44 kids test COVID-19 +ve in 1 week in Noida, 16 are below 18 yrs
318.article_body: The health department said on Friday that 44 children have tested positive for COVID-19 in the last week in Noida, Uttar Pradesh. Of them, 16 children are below 18 years. "Overall cases in Noida 167...The percentage of children affected is 26.3," the health department added. All schools have been asked to inform immediately if a child shows coronavirus-like symptoms.

319.title: NASA calls off its third attempt at Artemis 1 'wet dress rehearsal'
319.article_body: NASA called off the third attempt at 'wet dress rehearsal' for Artemis 1 mission on Thursday. Its attempt to fuel its huge moon rocket for a countdown test was thwarted by a hazardous hydrogen leak. The rocket's core stage liquid oxygen tank was about 49% filled and liquid hydrogen tank had been loaded to about 5% prior to the leak.

320.title: Israel successfully tests new laser missile defence system; shares video
320.article_body: Israel's Defence Minister Benny Gantz said Israel's new laser missile defence system has successfully intercepted UAVs, mortars, rockets, and anti-tank missiles in recent tests. The Israeli-made laser system will be operational "as soon as possible", and the goal is to deploy it around the country's borders over the next decade, he added. Gantz also shared a video of the tests.

321.title: Pant makes some weird noises while keeping and then says 'I was getting bored': Axar
321.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) all-rounder Axar Patel, while talking about Rishabh Pant, said that the wicketkeeper makes weird noises behind the stumps and then says, "I was getting bored." Axar added, "He'll randomly ask the fielder at point, 'Bro how's it going?' The person next to him [at slip] is always alert."

322.title: India-US need continued collaboration to face our 'biggest challenges': US
322.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has said, "I believe firmly that US and India need continued collaboration, hard work and leadership for the biggest challenges both countries face." The challenges could include combating COVID-19, building a more inclusive global economy or tackling the climate crisis, he stated. He was speaking at the Howard University for India-US Education Collaboration.

323.title: 3 thieves get life term for killing police officer in 2012 in Mumbai
323.article_body: Three robbers were sentenced to life imprisonment by a Mumbai sessions court on Wednesday for killing a policeman, identified as Dattu Sarnobat, in 2012 when he tried to stop them from stealing a car in Mumbai. Sarnobat, an assistant sub-inspector, landed on the car's bonnet while trying to stop them but the accused drove away. He died of his injuries.

324.title: 36-yr-old woman gang-raped in Delhi, 3 arrested within 4 hours
324.article_body: A 36-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped by three men in Delhi. All the three accused were arrested within four hours after committing the crime, police said on Friday. The accused have been identified as Naveen Singh Bhandari (28), Bishwa Mohan Acharya (26) and Akshay Taneja (30). Further investigation into the matter is underway, police said.

325.title: Right now there is 'hungama': Randhir on Alia-Ranbir wedding
325.article_body: Veteran actor Randhir Kapoor, speaking about his nephew actor Ranbir Kapoor's wedding with actress Alia Bhatt, said, "Nothing quiet now, abhi toh hungama hai (Right now there is uproar). Every day something is going on." Randhir further said they missed Ranbir's father late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor a lot at the wedding. Alia and Ranbir got married on April 14.

326.title: Anupam Kher touches younger brother's feet on film sets, says 'It was nice'
326.article_body: Anupam Kher shared some behind the scenes pictures from the sets of film 'Uunchai'. In one of the photographs, the actor can be seen touching the feet of his younger brother Raju Kher. "It was nice to touch my younger brother's feet in a scene in Sooraj Barjatya's...Uunchai. He was awkward but I got cheap thrills," Anupam captioned the pictures.

327.title: We're still a champion team: Suryakumar after MI's 5-match losing streak
327.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav said his side is still a champion team despite being at the bottom of IPL 2022 standings as they've lost all five matches they have played so far. "It's just a matter of a few games. The few people that have just joined in are doing really well," he added. MI will face LSG on Saturday.

328.title: Elon Musk is winning against GM, Ford, Toyota: Warren Buffett
328.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway Chairman Warren Buffett in an interview with Charlie Rose said Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "winning" against his competitors like GM, Ford and Toyota. He said all the firms against Musk have "got all the stuff" and Musk has "got an idea". "And he's winning. That's America. You can't dream it up. It's astounding," Buffett added.

329.title: Police remove saffron flags put up by Hindu Sena near JNU campus
329.article_body: Delhi Police removed the saffron flags and banners put up by Hindu Sena near the Jawaharlal Nehru University campus on Friday. Hindu Senda members put up posters protesting against the violence that broke out between the students' groups on Ram Navami. National President of Hindu Sena Vishnu Gupta said that by removing the flags, the police have disrespected the Constitution.

330.title: Photographers dance after Alia, Ranbir make appearance post-wedding, video viral
330.article_body: A video shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani shows photographers dancing after clicking pictures of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt in their wedding outfits. The photographers broke into a celebratory dance as soon as the couple went out of sight. The couple, who got married on Thursday at Ranbir's residence Vastu, wore outfits by fashion designer Sabyasachi for wedding ceremony.

331.title: RR haven't shown enough faith in Parag, Ashwin was sent ahead: Jaffer
331.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said RR have not shown enough faith in all-rounder Riyan Parag, adding that Ravichandran Ashwin was sent ahead of him in the match against LSG despite 10 overs left to bat. Parag recently stated that he can be the best finisher not just for RR but for India in the coming years.

332.title: 3 held for murder of MCOCA accused who was out on parole in Pune
332.article_body: Pune's Wanowrie Police have arrested three men for killing Sunny alias Girish Hiwale, who was released on parole on April 9. Sunny was shot to death by rival gang members near his house on April 12. Reportedly, Sunny had four criminal cases lodged against him and he was booked under the Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA) in 2021.

333.title: Cow smuggling syndicate busted in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, 5 held
333.article_body: A cow smuggling syndicate was busted in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut and five accused have been arrested, police said. "During the interrogation, the accused disclosed that they used to smuggle cattle from different states and take them to Assam from where they were smuggled to Bangladesh," police added. Notably, Assam Police had announced a reward of ₹2 lakh on an accused.

334.title: Rapido raises $180 million led by Swiggy at $800 million valuation
334.article_body: Bike taxi startup Rapido on Friday announced that it has raised $180 million in funding led by homegrown food delivery startup Swiggy. TVS Motor Company and Rapido's existing investors Westbridge, Shell Ventures and Nexus Ventures also participated in the startup's Series D funding round. Founded in 2015, the Bengaluru-based startup is now valued at $800 million.

335.title: Tunisia detains female journalist who called police 'dogs'
335.article_body: A Tunisian court on Thursday detained a female journalist who criticised police and the Interior Minister Taoufik Charfeddine, the main journalism union said. Chahrazed Akacha, in a Facebook post, had reportedly accused police of insulting, beating her, and taking off her veil in the street. She had called on the Interior Minister to control his policemen, describing them as "dogs".

336.title: I had suicidal thoughts but not related to body issues: Ileana
336.article_body: Actress Ileana D'Cruz in an interview has stated that she had suicidal thoughts when she hit a really low point in her life, however, they were not related to her body issues. "Those are two separate issues so I didn't like the fact that they clubbed them together like that, 'Oh you know because she had body issues'," she added.

337.title: PMPML to celebrate April 18 as 'Bus Day', commuters to get discounts
337.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) will celebrate April 18 as "Bus Day" by bringing in 1,800 buses on city roads. On April 19, it'll celebrate its foundation day and will provide the service at a concessional rate to all commuters. Buses will charge a minimum fare of ₹5 and a maximum fare of ₹10 in PMC and PCMC areas.

338.title: PM looks the same, what's your secret sir: Grammy winner Ricky on pics from 2015 & 2022
338.article_body: Grammy-winning Indian composer Ricky Kej shared pictures with PM Narendra Modi. He wrote, "7 year challenge!! Pic 1: 2015 when I won my 1st Grammy...Pic 2: 2022 when I won 2nd Grammy. Hon'ble PM @narendramodi ji looks EXACTLY the same...but I have aged a lot :-) hahahaha...What is your secret sir??" "Happy to have met you," PM Modi tweeted.

339.title: Vijay's 'Beast' crosses ₹100-crore mark globally in 2 days
339.article_body: Vijay's latest action film 'Beast' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark globally in just two days of its release, according to film trade analyst Ramesh Bala. In a tweet, Ramesh mentioned that the Hindi version of 'Beast' earned ₹50 lakh in India on day one. The film, which features Vijay as a RAW officer, was released in theatres on April 13.

340.title: Damn impressed by Hardik, he can lead India in shorter formats: Manoj Tiwary
340.article_body: Cricketer-turned-politician Manoj Tiwary said that he's "damn impressed" by GT captain Hardik Pandya's leadership, adding that he can lead India in shorter formats. Hardik scored 87*(52) against RR in their IPL 2022 match on Thursday. GT jumped to top of the points table after their win against RR. They have won four out of their five matches.

341.title: Headless person with no limbs spotted walking in New York on Google Maps
341.article_body: Google Maps users have spotted a headless person with no limbs walking in a hazmat suit on a street in New York. Pictures from Google Maps shared online show the person in hazmat suit walking, dancing and playing tricks around the area. The area is said to be Brooklyn Navy Yard in New York City.

342.title: MI had a shocking auction, Kishan not worth blowing nearly your whole salary on: Watson
342.article_body: Talking about MI being placed last on the IPL 2022 points table, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said that he is not surprised as MI had a shocking auction. He added that MI shouldn't have spent so much money on Ishan Kishan. "He's a very talented and skilful player, but he’s not worth blowing nearly your whole salary on," Watson stated.

343.title: Musk asks Twitter users if taking Twitter private should be up to shareholders
343.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk has started a poll on Twitter asking users whether the decision to take Twitter private should be up to the company's shareholders. "Taking Twitter private at $54.20 should be up to shareholders, not the board," the poll reads. Musk has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion, saying it is his "best and final offer".

344.title: Kolkata traffic policeman teaches boy while on duty; pic surfaces
344.article_body: Kolkata Police has shared a picture of a traffic police officer teaching an eight-year-old boy while managing traffic as well and captioned it, "The teacher cop." The police said that Sergeant Prakash Ghosh had promised to help the boy after the latter's mother, who works at a roadside food stall, approached him. A local journalist had taken the picture.

345.title: Student injured as portion of bathroom ceiling collapses at JNU hostel in Delhi
345.article_body: A student was injured after a portion of a bathroom ceiling collapsed at Sabarmati Hostel of Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), officials said. The injured student was taken to the Safdarjung Hospital for treatment. "This is a clear case of criminal negligence on part of the hostel wardens and the Dean of Students," an All India Students' Association activist said.

346.title: Bengaluru police help rescue doctor's pets after bank sealed home
346.article_body: Bengaluru police on Thursday rescued the pets of a doctor whose house was reportedly sealed by bank officials nearly a week ago after she defaulted on a home loan payment. An animal rights group member had posted about the incident on Twitter after the doctor approached the group. The pets included two cats, two tortoises and a large aquarium.

347.title: Police stop a driverless car for not having headlights on in US, video surfaces
347.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed police in San Francisco stopping a car driving without headlights, only to find that it was an autonomous vehicle with no one inside. The car was operated by Cruise, an autonomous car company backed by General Motors in the US. Cruise later said the headlights' issue was due to human error.

348.title: Kristen Stewart to star in romantic thriller 'Love Lies Bleeding'
348.article_body: Kristen Stewart has signed on to star in romantic thriller titled 'Love Lies Bleeding'. According to Hollywood Reporter, the actress will be seen playing the co-lead of the story. Directed by 'Saint Maud' maker Rose Glass, the film will be backed by A24 and Film4. The script of the film has been written by Rose Glass and Weronika Tofilska.

349.title: Court rejects actor Armaan Kohli's bail plea in drugs case
349.article_body: A special court in Mumbai rejected Armaan Kohli's bail application in drugs case. The actor was arrested by NCB in August last year over alleged possession of 1.2 grams of cocaine. Armaan had filed for bail on grounds that drugs recovered from him fall under small quantity under the NDPS Act and his co-accused had also been released on bail.

350.title: Germans should save energy to reduce reliance on Russia: Min
350.article_body: Germany's Economy Minister Robert Habeck said that Germans should start saving energy now to become more independent from Russian gas and oil. "Every kilometre not driven is a contribution to making it easier to get away from Russian energy supplies," he added. Germany is looking for ways to cut Russian oil and gas imports in response to the Ukraine war.

351.title: SP leader resigns citing Akhilesh's silence over 'atrocities against Muslims'
351.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Mohammad Kasim Raeen resigned from the party citing "no action" by Akhilesh Yadav and others against "rising incidents of atrocities meted out to Muslims" in UP. He said that the party is "not interested" in raising its voice against incidents like imprisonment of Azam Khan and his family and demolition of MLA Shazil Islam Ansari's petrol pump.

352.title: India to get record number of new doctors in next 10 years: PM Modi
352.article_body: India will get a record number of doctors in the coming 10 years, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Friday.
