"Whether it is the goal of building medical colleges in every district...or efforts to make medical education accessible to all, the country is going to get a record number of new doctors in the coming 10 years," he said.

353.title: Rock found in 2011 confirmed to be hottest rock on record: Study
353.article_body: The University of Western Ontario has said the rock found in 2011, which was then called the hottest rock on the planet, has been confirmed to be the hottest indeed. A recent study found four additional zircon grains in the rock that confirmed the rock's record-high temperature of 2,370°C. That rock was formed as a result of an asteroid impact.

354.title: 2 booked for playing pro-Pakistan songs in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly
354.article_body: Two persons identified as Naeem and Mustkim of Singhai Murawan village in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly have been booked for allegedly hampering national integration by playing pro-Pakistan songs. The accused reportedly played the songs on a mobile phone at high volume in a shop. They also picked up a fight with a resident who objected to it, police said on Thursday.

355.title: Joe Root steps down as England Test captain
355.article_body: Joe Root has stepped down as the captain of England men's Test team. "It has been the most challenging decision I've had to make in my career but having discussed this with my family and those closest to me; I know the timing is right," he said. Root was appointed Test captain in 2017. He led England in 64 Tests.

356.title: Shanghai officials assault citizens over vacating their houses for quarantine sites
356.article_body: A purported video has surfaced online that showed people wearing hazmat suits with the word  "police" on their back getting into violent fights and assaulting citizens in Shanghai, in order to get them to surrender their homes for COVID-19 quarantine facilities amid rising cases. A woman could also be heard weeping as she filmed the scene.

357.title: 14 IPS officers transferred in UP; Vikas Vaidya gets Hathras SP charge
357.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government transferred 14 IPS officers in the state on Friday. As per the new order, IPS Vikas Vaidya will replace Hathras Superintendent of Police (SP) Vineet Jaiswal who has been sent to Amroha. Meanwhile, Moradabad SSP Bablu Kumar and Amroha SP Poonam were removed and kept on the waiting list.

358.title: Raj Thackeray to hold 'maha aarti' in Pune tomorrow amid loudspeaker row
358.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray will hold a 'maha aarti' in Pune on Saturday, on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanti. This comes amid Thackeray's demands seeking the removal of loudspeakers in mosques. Thackeray had earlier threatened to play 'Hanuman Chalisa' in front of mosques if loudspeakers in mosques were not silenced.

359.title: COVID-19 testing to be increased in Gurugram: Officials
359.article_body: With the surge in the number of COVID-19 cases in Gurugram, the state health department will increase COVID-19 testing in the district, health department officials said. About 3,000 to 4,000 samples will be tested every day, they added. The testing numbers were reportedly reduced to fewer than 1,500 samples a day after COVID-related restrictions were lifted in Gurugram.

360.title: China holds military drills around Taiwan as US delegation visits
360.article_body: China said it conducted military drills around Taiwan on Friday as a US Congressional delegation visited the China-claimed island. The operation is intended to target the "wrong signals" sent by US over Taiwan, People's Liberation Army Eastern Theater Command spokesman Shi Yilu said. He added the US' actions are "very dangerous" and "those who play with fire will burn themselves".

361.title: Saffron flags, 'Bhagwa JNU' posters put up outside campus by Hindu Sena
361.article_body: Hindu Sena members put up saffron flags and "Bhagwa JNU" posters outside Jawaharlal Nehru University campus on Friday which were later removed by the police. "Inside JNU, saffron...Hindutva are constantly being insulted," National President of Hindu Sena Vishnu Gupta said. Commenting on police action, Gupta added, "Even police should not be in such a hurry to take down saffron flags."

362.title: US links N Korean hackers to one of biggest crypto heists of $600 mn
362.article_body: The US has linked North Korean hackers to the theft of over $600 million from a blockchain network connected to the Axie Infinity online game in one of the biggest crypto heists to date. The FBI has attributed the hack to the Lazarus Group, the blockchain network said. The US Treasury has sanctioned the address that received the stolen funds.

363.title: Local admin doesn't invite me to govt events as I'm Dalit: BJP MP
363.article_body: BJP MP from Maharashtra's Latur Sudhakar Shrangare has accused the local administration of not inviting him to government events as he's a Dalit. This comes after a Dr BR Ambedkar statue was unveiled in the district by Union Minister Ramdas Athawale and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday. "I'm not invited purposely. They can't see my work," Shrangare said.

364.title: High cardiovascular risk associated with symptoms of depression: Study
364.article_body: As cardiovascular diseases and depression show similar risk factors like inflammation and oxidative stress, they might be closely related. As per new study, cardiovascular risk factors are linked with an increased risk of depression in older adults, especially in women. Though researchers suggest that depression could be a risk factor for these diseases, studies suggesting vice versa are scarce.

365.title: Hyderabad police arrest 2 people for betting on IPL matches
365.article_body: Hyderabad's Mangalhat Police arrested two people for betting on IPL matches and seized ₹41,500 cash, 2 cellphones and TV. According to police, accused Gopi Singh used to organise betting from his house in Mangalhat along with his friends, Anand Singh and Sonu. Acting on a tip-off, the police raided the location late on Tuesday night and arrested Gopi and Anand.

366.title: Bus driver assaulted in road rage incident on expressway in Greater Noida
366.article_body: A bus driver was allegedly assaulted by two men in a road rage incident on the Yamuna Expressway in Greater Noida. According to the police, one of the two accused is a cab driver. Notably, the police received the complaint through their Twitter handle, the Assistant Commissioner of Police (Greater Noida 3) Brijnandan Rai said.

367.title: 3 held including cousin for murder of 10 year old boy in Ghaziabad
367.article_body: The Ghaziabad Police arrested three persons on charges of kidnapping a 10-year-old boy, Harsh Singh, for ransom and later murdering him at a park in Noida on April 11. According to the police, among those arrested include Harsh's cousin, Priyanshu Singh, who allegedly executed the crime to extort ₹15 lakh from Harsh's family. The suspects are residents of Khoda, Ghaziabad.

368.title: 10-yr-old boy beaten by drunk criminal lawyer at housing society in Thane
368.article_body: A 10-year-old boy, resident of a housing society in Thane, was hospitalised after he was allegedly beaten by a criminal lawyer from the same society, while the latter was under the influence of alcohol. The incident took place when the victim was playing with his friends inside the society premises. He claimed the accused allegedly threatened to beat him again.

369.title: Left-arm pacer Arshdeep could be a great option for Team India: Parthiv
369.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said PBKS left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh could be a great option for Team India who need a left-arm pacer. "He was with Team India during the Sri Lanka series. Arshdeep is being recognised and he is improving day by day," added Parthiv. "Arshdeep is doing the job which is often difficult for a pacer," stated Parthiv.

370.title: Resignation not enough, arrest Eshwarappa: Cong on K'taka contractor's suicide
370.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar demanded arrest of state minister KS Eshwarappa in connection with the death case of contractor Santosh Patil and said that "resignation is not a solution". "A case of corruption has to be registered, then he (KS Eshwarappa) has to be arrested," Shivakumar said. The contractor's family has alleged that he was tortured, Shivakumar further added.

371.title: 3 shops, Ambedkar Jayanti stage hoardings gutted in fire in Pune
371.article_body: Three shops and hoardings on a stage set up for Ambedkar Jayanti were gutted in a fire near Pune's railway station on Thursday morning, officials said. Firefighters were able to bring the blaze under control and averted a major incident by removing five gas cylinders from one of the shops. The stage's rear side was close to the shops.

372.title: Delhi PWD to take up repair works along key roads stretching 254 km
372.article_body: Public Works Department (PWD) in Delhi will take up repair and strengthening works along key arterial roads stretching 254 kilometres, officials said. The department has received administrative approval for the work which will start in the coming days, a PWD official added. PWD has already commenced strengthening works along 171.68 kilometres of roads in the national capital, officials stated.

373.title: Indian Idol 12's Sayli Kamble to tie the knot with fiancé Dhawal on April 24
373.article_body: Sayli Kamble, the second runner-up on 'Indian Idol 12', is all set to tie the knot with her fiancé Dhawal on April 24. Speaking to ETimes, Sayli said that she's "very excited and waiting for the day". "All the preparations are done. Now we're just waiting for the big day," she added. Sayli and Dhawal got engaged in December 2021.

374.title: Indian-origin doctor found guilty of sexually abusing 48 patients over 35 yrs in Scotland
374.article_body: Krishna Singh, a 72-year-old Indian-origin doctor, has been found guilty of sexually abusing 48 female patients over 35 years in Scotland. He was accused of kissing, groping, giving inappropriate examinations and making sleazy comments. An investigation into his conduct was launched after one woman reported him in 2018. He was subsequently arrested and charged in April 2018.

375.title: Police call bomb threat to B'luru schools 'cyber terrorism': Report
375.article_body: Karnataka Police have filed a case under the Information Technology Act over hoax bomb threat emails to over 10 schools in Bengaluru, IANS reported. The police also reportedly called them acts of "cyber terrorism". Meanwhile, the city's Additional Police Commissioner (East Zone) said, "Once the miscreants behind the hoax bomb case get arrested, the intention and objectives will be known."

376.title: Vanguard Group replaces Musk as Twitter's largest shareholder with 10.3% stake
376.article_body: Days after Tesla CEO Elon Musk disclosed being the largest shareholder at Twitter with a 9.2% stake, the position has now been taken by US' Vanguard Group. In its recent publicly available filings with the US Securities and Exchange Commission, the company disclosed owning 82.4 million shares of Twitter, which means 10.3%. Vanguard's holdings are reportedly worth $3.78 billion now.

377.title: Jos Buttler smashes highest individual score in powerplay in IPL 2022
377.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler on Thursday smashed the highest individual score in powerplay in IPL 2022. The 31-year-old scored 54 runs off 24 deliveries during the powerplay against GT. He overtook DC's Prithvi Shaw, who had scored an unbeaten 47 off 27 deliveries in the powerplay against LSG. Robin Uthappa scored 45*(21) in powerplay against LSG.

378.title: Three die after drowning in dam while bathing in Chhattisgarh
378.article_body: Three people, including a woman, died after drowning in the Kukda dam in Chhattisgarh's Gariaband on Wednesday. The trio, identified as Rita Kumari, Lakshya Kumar and Rakesh Tete, had gone to the dam for a picnic and were bathing in the river at the time of the incident, police said. Their bodies were recovered with the help of local fishermen.

379.title: Out for playing with dad, 6-yr-old dies as garbage van crushes him in Gujarat
379.article_body: A six-year-old boy died after he was crushed under wheels of the garbage collection van of the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC). The 22-year-old driver of the garbage van was later arrested. "The driver reversed the van without checking properly...The child, who was with his father...was crushed under the wheels and died on his way to hospital," police said.

380.title: Alia & Ranbir dance at their wedding afterparty, video goes viral
380.article_body: A video of Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor dancing at their wedding afterparty has surfaced online. In the clip, the couple can be seen dancing to the song ‘Chaiyya Chaiyya’. They tied the knot on April 14 in an intimate wedding at Ranbir’s residence Vastu. Alia while sharing photos from the wedding wrote, "Can't wait to build more memories together".

381.title: I feel lucky: Raghav on 'Teri Baaton' going viral after 18 years of release
381.article_body: Singer Raghav, whose song 'Teri Baaton' is trending on social media after 18 years of its release, said music that's made from the heart never fails to connect. "I feel lucky. The idea that music can revive to this degree after so long is...great compliment," he added. Reportedly, over 1.5 million reels have been made on the song so far.

382.title: Zelenskyy praises Ukrainians for withstanding 50 days of war
382.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy hailed his people for their resolve since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24 and for making "the most important decision of their life- to fight". "We've withstood 50 days...50 days of Russian invasion, although the occupiers gave us a maximum of five," Zelenskyy said. Ukraine has become "a hero for the whole free world", he added.

383.title: PM Modi inaugurates KK Patel Super Speciality Hospital in Gujarat's Bhuj
383.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated KK Patel Super Speciality Hospital in Gujarat's Bhuj via video conferencing. The 200-bed hospital is the first charitable super speciality hospital in Kutch, the official statement said. "The hospital will make good quality healthcare accessible to people at an affordable price," PM tweeted. The hospital has been built by Shree Kutchi Leva Patel Samaj.

384.title: 7 children die due to suspected viral disease in Rajasthan's Sirohi
384.article_body: Seven children have died in the last few days due to a suspected viral disease in Rajasthan's Sirohi district. "These deaths have occurred due to a viral [disease]. A survey of the village has been done. The situation is now under control," state Health Minister Parsadi Lal Meena said. "Teams from Jaipur and Jodhpur have also reached there," Meena added.

385.title: Musk's Twitter bid probably not good for me: Teenager who tracked his jet
385.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old who tracked Elon Musk's private jet, reacted to Musk's Twitter offer, saying, "Oh no. Probably good for Twitter but probably not me lol." "I mean if he really wanted to then he could shut me down," Sweeney told Business Insider. Earlier, Sweeney asked TED Head Chris Anderson to ask Musk what made him buy Twitter stock.

386.title: Rahane has been out of form for years, any team would've dropped him: Manjrekar
386.article_body: Talking about KKR batter Ajinkya Rahane, ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said, "If Rahane had to be dropped on form, any team would have done it long back...He hasn't been in form for a few years now." "If KKR play Rahane, it will be in hope because he struggled a lot in the last game [against DC] too," added Manjrekar.

387.title: Alert sounded in Bihar's Supaul amid bird flu outbreak in village
387.article_body: An alert has been sounded in Bihar's Supaul following a bird flu outbreak in Chhapkahi village. Unnatural deaths of birds were reported on March 31, following which specimen of a duckling was sent to Bhopal for testing. "Within one kilometre of the area where the birds were found dead, culling of ducks and hens will be done," Supaul DM said.

388.title: BJP, AIMIM spreading communal violence in country: Congress leader
388.article_body: Congress leader Sajjan Singh Verma on Thursday blamed the BJP and AIMIM for spreading communal violence in the country. "BJP and...AIMIM played a crucial role in Khargone communal violence. They deliberately want to create an atmosphere of tension in India, "Verma said. He claimed that BJP never talks about real issues, adding, "They only want people to remember their religion."

389.title: Took risks, ensured it comes off unlike last game: Hardik on 52-ball 87*
389.article_body: Reacting to his unbeaten 87 off 52 balls against RR, GT captain Hardik Pandya said he took risks and ensured it comes off unlike the previous game against SRH, where he scored a 42-ball 50*. "I am not used to batting this long. It is difficult but now [batting at number four position] I can control the game," added Hardik.

390.title: Canada health officials mistakenly tweet Pornhub link instead of COVID-19 portal
390.article_body: The health ministry in Canada’s Quebec accidentally shared a link to an adult video from the Pornhub website featuring foot fetishes instead of sharing a link to the COVID-19 portal. The ministry deleted the tweet soon after and wrote, "Due to a situation beyond our control, a link with inappropriate content was posted on our Twitter...We're looking for the causes."

391.title: I wasn't allowed to enter temple for being Dalit: Former K'taka Deputy CM
391.article_body: Senior Congress leader and former Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister G Parameshwara has claimed that he wasn't allowed to enter a temple, despite his PhD qualification and the position he has held, as he is a Dalit. "They stopped me [outside] and brought 'mangala arati' there itself," Parameshwara said. "Such a system exists even today in this society," he added.

392.title: Sharad Pawar first to use the word 'Hindu terror': Devendra Fadnavis
392.article_body: Maharashtra ex-CM Devendra Fadnavis criticised NCP chief Sharad Pawar and said that his party has an old track record of "appeasement politics and polarising the society on communal basis". He further said that Pawar was the first person to use the word "Hindu terror". The NCP has grand plans on bringing a Muslim quota in Maharashtra, the BJP leader added.

393.title: 25-yr-old man murders lover over suspicion of an affair in Gujarat; held
393.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested in Gujarat's Chhotaudepur for allegedly murdering his 23-year-old girlfriend over suspicion of an affair. The accused, Karshan Rathwa had picked up the woman on his bike on Tuesday. "When she received a call...from another man...he (Rathwa) questioned her about the affair. They had a fight and he strangulated her on the spot," police said.

394.title: HC awards ₹2.5 cr compensation to family of accident victim who died
394.article_body: Bombay High Court awarded ₹2.5 crore as compensation to family of an accident victim who died in 2011. The family had challenged an earlier order of giving them ₹1.03 crore as compensation and sought an enhancement of the amount. HC directed a tempo driver, involved in the accident, and an insurance company to pay the rest amount within a month.

395.title: Protesting farmers in H'yana file 'missing' complaint of local MP
395.article_body: Farmers, who've been holding a protest seeking compensation for their damaged crops for a month in Haryana's Hisar, have filed a "missing" complaint of the local BJP MP Brijendra Singh with police. A Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) leader claimed that "the public is searching for Singh as development projects are halted". A police spokesperson confirmed that the complaint was filed.

396.title: There's something that RR have seen in Parag, which we haven't in last 3 years: Manjrekar
396.article_body: Talking about RR's 20-year-old all-rounder Riyan Parag, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "There's something that RR have seen in him, which we haven't seen in last three years." Manjrekar stated, "In his two full IPL seasons...he averaged about 11. His strike rate was around 110. They went for him in auction and bought him at a much higher price of ₹3.8 crore."

397.title: Saudi prince, a major Twitter shareholder, rejects Musk's offer; he replies
397.article_body: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal Al Saud, a billionaire and one of Twitter's largest shareholders, rejected Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter saying his offer isn't close to the company's "intrinsic value". Meanwhile, Musk replied, "Just two questions...How much of Twitter does the Kingdom own, directly & indirectly? What are the Kingdom's views on journalistic freedom of speech?"

398.title: 2 women caught while taking lift from contractor they earlier robbed in G'gram
398.article_body: Two women were arrested in Gurugram after they took a lift from a contractor, four months after they robbed him of ₹3.5 lakh using the same modus operandi. Last year, they had taken lift from the contractor and stole ₹3.5 lakh kept in a bag. On Wednesday, the contractor traced them asking for a lift on the same route.

399.title: Pope Francis visits Italian prison for foot-washing ritual
399.article_body: Pope Francis visited an Italian prison and washed and kissed the feet of 12 inmates in a Holy Thursday ritual that symbolizes humility and service. The 12 inmates included men and women of various ages and different nationalities, the Vatican said. In the past two years, scaled-down versions of the service were held inside the Vatican because of COVID-19 curbs.

400.title: Tribal Odisha woman slits 3-yr-old son's throat in intoxicated state; arrested
400.article_body: A tribal woman from Odisha's Koraput district has been arrested after she, in an intoxicated state, slit the throat of her three-year-old son. Police claimed the accused had a raucous celebration of the Chaiti festival with her husband and neighbours with heavy drinking and feasts. The next day, she came to her senses and started repenting her crime, police added.

401.title: Curfew relaxed in riot-hit Khargone in MP; only women allowed to step out
401.article_body: Curfew was relaxed for two hours on Thursday in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone, where communal clashes broke out during Ram Navami celebrations. According to Khargone Collector Anugrah P, only women were allowed to step out of their homes and buy essential commodities during the two-hour relaxation provided from 10 am. Only milk, vegetable, medical and provision stores were opened.

402.title: Punjab govt must release ₹800 cr dues of sugarcane farmers: Partap Bajwa
402.article_body: Punjab government must release nearly ₹800 crore worth of dues to sugarcane farmers, Leader of Opposition in Vidhan Sabha Partap Singh Bajwa said. "On March 22, I had written to the CM...Till date, I have received no response of the same," the Congress leader added. "This situation is untenable...sugarcane farmers of Punjab have not been paid since February," Bajwa added.

403.title: India has to grow big, those blocking way will be eliminated: RSS chief
403.article_body: Addressing a gathering in Haridwar, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that India has to grow big and its rise is incumbent upon the rise of 'dharma'. Comparing India's progress to that of a vehicle that only has an accelerator and no brakes, Bhagwat said that those trying to stop it "will either step aside or be eliminated".
